0.title: Sidharth Malhotra, Kiara Advani scout wedding venues in Chandigarh: Report
0.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra and his rumoured girlfriend Kiara Advani are reportedly scouting wedding venues in Chandigarh. As per a source close to Sidharth, the duo contacted The Oberoi Sukhvilas Spa & Resorts, which is the same location where Rajkummar Rao and Patralekhaa tied the knot. The source added that the rumoured couple dropped the plans of getting married in Goa.

1.title: Rahul Gandhi performs tribal folk dance in Telangana, Cong shares video
1.article_body: During the ongoing 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was seen performing a traditional folk dance, 'Dhimsa', in Telangana. Gandhi was joined by folk artists and state Congress chief Revanth Reddy during the dance. In another video, the Congress leader was seen whipping himself as part of a local tradition in Telangana.

2.title: Student throws money on dancing classmate, thrashed by teacher; video surfaces
2.article_body: A student was beaten up by a teacher after he threw currency notes on another student who was dancing at a school function in Uttar Pradesh's Baghpat. A video of the incident that took place in Alpine Public School has gone viral on social media. The video shows teacher thrashing the student with a stick.

3.title: 2 smuggle 2,112 liquor bottles hiding them between doors, held by Delhi Police
3.article_body: Two persons were arrested in Delhi on Thursday for attempting to smuggle 2,112 bottles of liquor into Bihar by hiding them inside wooden doors, police said. According to the police, the two smugglers were taking the bottles from Delhi to Bihar on a tempo by stacking them inside hollow doors. The bottles were cleverly concealed, a police official said.

4.title: SC dismisses plea to rename Bombay High Court to Maharashtra High Court
4.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday dismissed a plea to rename the Bombay High Court to Maharashtra High Court. The plea was filed by a former judge VP Patil who had served as a judge for 26 years. "These are issues for lawmakers to decide. What fundamental right is prejudiced for you to bring it here?" SC said.

5.title: KCR is PM Modi's copy in terms of attitude, thoughts: Rahul
5.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said that Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao is "a copy" of Prime Minister Narendra Modi in terms of attitude and thoughts. Furthermore, he said that Rao supported BJP in every bill in the Parliament. Currently, Rahul Gandhi is in Telangana for the Congress party’s Bharat Jodo Yatra.

6.title: Central Railway ticket checkers collect ₹1 cr fine each from violators
6.article_body: Central Railway's four ticket checkers in Mumbai Division collected around ₹1 crore each in the current financial year from 53,697 ticketless travellers, an official said. One of the train ticket inspectors caught 15,053 violators and collected ₹1.43 crore fine. Another caught 14,837 ticketless travellers and levied a fine of ₹1.34 crore. The two others collected around ₹1.03 crore fine each.

7.title: Example of BJP's misgovernance in Guj: Owaisi on Morbi bridge collapse
7.article_body: Following the Morbi bridge collapse incident in Gujarat, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Thursday said what happened in Morbi is unfortunate and gives an example of BJP’s "misgovernance" in the state. Furthermore, he said, "Due to the misgovernance of BJP in Gujarat, many people lost lives during COVID-19. There is inflation and businesses have been affected."

8.title: Cannot go on any bridge now: Morbi bridge tragedy survivor
8.article_body: A survivor of the Morbi suspension bridge tragedy, in which over 135 people were killed, said that he gets scared every time he looks at the bridge. "I don't think I can go on any bridge now," the survivor said adding that the Morbi bridge was his favourite hangout spot, and he regularly visited it for several years.

9.title: Traffic disrupted as oil spilled on Sinhagad Road in Pune
9.article_body: Traffic was briefly disrupted after an unidentified vehicle reportedly spilled oil on Sinhagad Road between Pune's Panmala and Rajaram Bridge on Thursday morning. A fire brigade team rushed to the spot and threw sand and dust on the road to prevent accidents. Fire brigade officials claimed that they were unaware of how oil had spilled onto the road.

10.title: GIC, ESR establish $600 mn JV in India for industrial, logistics assets
10.article_body: GIC and ESR Group have set up a joint venture (JV) worth $600 million to buy profit-making industrial and logistics assets in India. The companies said the JV will invest in "stabilised operational assets" in tier 1 and tier 2 cities of the country. The JV is an extension of an existing partnership between the entities in the country.

11.title: When we got engaged, people said he's marrying an aunty: Kapil Dev's wife
11.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Kapil Dev's wife Romi Dev told Sonakshi Sinha and Huma Qureshi that they've lived her life in their film 'Double XL'. Talking about the film and its subject, Romi recalled being body-shamed and how when she got engaged to Kapil Dev, people said he was marrying an aunty. She said she "loved every minute" of the film.

12.title: Indian bowlers got smashed vs Bangladesh, this is a wake-up call: Raina
12.article_body: Ex-India batter Suresh Raina said the Indian bowling attack got "smashed around" during their T20 World Cup 2022 match against Bangladesh, adding that it was a "learning curve" for them. "We might have won but even Rohit Sharma admitted...that Bangladesh were better than India. This is a wake-up call," added Raina. "The match was in Bangladesh's favour," he stated.

13.title: Shinde govt formed to serve Guj instead of Maha: NCP's Jayant Patil
13.article_body: NCP leader Jayant Patil on Thursday criticised the Eknath Shinde-led Maharashtra government over the loss of big industrial projects and accused it of "serving Gujarat". "Projects are being shifted to Gujarat and the CM and Deputy CM are mute spectators," Patil said. "Conspiracy was hatched to bring a new government...so that the...government would serve Gujarat more than Maharashtra," he added.

14.title: Mumbai man cheated of ₹50 lakh by HK woman posing as crypto analyst
14.article_body: A Mumbai man has filed a police complaint after being allegedly defrauded of ₹50.40 lakh by a Hong Kong-based woman. The woman, who allegedly posed as a cryptocurrency analyst at JP Morgan, Hong Kong, befriended the man on WhatsApp earlier this year. The woman persuaded him to invest in a crypto coin of the People's Bank of China.

15.title: Boeing could generate $100 bn in revenue annually by 2025: CEO
15.article_body: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun said the US planemaker could generate $100 billion in revenue annually by 2025. Boeing last recorded $100 billion in revenue in 2018. In its first public investor meeting since 2016, Boeing said it expects to deliver 800 commercial jets at least by 2025, pegging the MAX and 787 production per month at 50 and 10, respectively.

16.title: Archean Chemical Industries sets price band for IPO at ₹386-407
16.article_body: Archean Chemical Industries, a speciality marine chemical manufacturer, said it has fixed a price band of ₹386-407 a share for its ₹1,462-crore initial public offering. The offer is going to be opened for subscription on November 9 and the closing date will be November 11. The bidding for anchor investors will open on November 7, according to the company.

17.title: Mere possession of jihadi literature is not an offence: Delhi court to NIA
17.article_body: While dealing with an Unlawful Activities Prevention Act (UAPA) case, a Delhi court said it was unfathomable that "mere possession of jihadi literature" or philosophy "would amount to an offence". NIA has accused 11 people of aligning themselves with the terrorist organisation Islamic State of Iraq and Syria and "being part of various ISIS propaganda channels" on social media applications.

18.title: Rajeev proposes lie detector test after Charu's cheating allegations
18.article_body: After Charu Asopa accused her husband Rajeev Sen of cheating on her, the latter said that couples should take a lie detector test, especially when they don't have proof for their respective allegations. In a new interview, Charu responded to Rajeev's statement and said she is "ready" to take a lie detector test, adding that she's "only spoken the truth".

19.title: Magical, took a lot of presence of mind: Gavaskar on Rahul's run out
19.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said Bangladesh opener Litton Das' run out following a direct hit by KL Rahul during the T20 World Cup 2022 match between India and Bangladesh was a "magical moment". "[It] took a lot of presence of mind...He had to change his shape while throwing," added Gavaskar. "The run out...turned the game on its head," he stated.

20.title: When India says something on global forum, others listen carefully: Rajnath Singh
20.article_body: Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Thursday said that today when India says anything on the global forum, other countries listen carefully. Singh was addressing a political rally in poll-bound Himachal Pradesh. "No one can deny the fact that after PM Modi became Prime Minister, India's prestige increased on the global stage," Singh added.

21.title: No new commitments made to Russia beyond terms of grain deal: Ukraine
21.article_body: Ukraine has said it made no new commitments to Russia beyond the terms agreed under the Black Sea Grains Initiative to persuade Moscow to resume its participation in the deal. The clarification comes after the Russian Defence Ministry said that it received guarantees from Ukraine that it would not use the Black Sea grain corridor for military purposes against Russia.

22.title: 1-yr-old girl kidnapped in Mumbai rescued from Solapur, 2 women arrested
22.article_body: A one-year-old girl, who was kidnapped from Mumbai's Santacruz area four days ago, was rescued and two women were arrested, police said on Thursday. The women were allegedly trying to sell the toddler in Telangana. The toddler was rescued from Solapur railway station by the Mumbai Police Crime Branch with the help of RPF, Mumbai Police Commissioner Vivek Phansalkar said.

23.title: Unconscious patient lies on floor in UP hospital while dog licks blood, video surfaces
23.article_body: A video, that surfaced online, showed a man covered in blood and lying unconscious on the floor of an emergency ward of a government hospital in Uttar Pradesh while a street dog roamed around him licking blood. Later, Chief Medical Superintendent Satendra Kumar Verma said that action was taken against four officials and the man was referred to another hospital.

24.title: Sack the medical panel: Kamran after Fakhar gets ruled out of T20 WC
24.article_body: Talking about Pakistan batter Fakhar Zaman being ruled out of T20 World Cup 2022, Pakistani wicketkeeper Kamran Akmal said, "The medical panel, selectors, captain and coach are answerable. The medical panel should be sacked." "PCB has kept this medical panel on what basis? They don't know about injuries...The ones fit and scoring runs in domestic cricket...face...criticism," added Kamran.

25.title: Coinbase Chief Product Officer Surojit Chatterjee resigns
25.article_body: US-based cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase's Chief Product Officer Surojit Chatterjee has resigned from his position, the company filing said. The decision was "mutually agreed" upon and Chatterjee will serve the company in an advisory role until February 2023, Coinbase said. Earlier this year, Coinbase had cut its team size by 18%, a decision that CEO Brian Armstrong attributed to recession.

26.title: Govt not serious about ‘monstrous’ problem: Varun Gandhi on Delhi’s air quality
26.article_body: With air quality deteriorating in Delhi, BJP MP Varun Gandhi on Thursday said neither the government nor the public are serious about resolving this "monstrous" problem. "Eight out of 10 children in Delhi-NCR have respiratory problems. After years of discussions, why is there a continuing lack of concern and coordination between multiple government entities?" he added.

27.title: Video shows 3-storey building collapsing in Ghaziabad due to digging work
27.article_body: A 3-storeyed building collapsed in Ghaziabad on Wednesday afternoon after developing cracks because of digging work done on a nearby plot by a builder. A video of the incident shows people screaming while the building collapses. One of the residents claimed that the builder hadn't informed anyone about the digging work.

28.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra stopped religious polarisation in T'gana: Cong MP
28.article_body: AICC Minority Department Chairman and Congress Rajya Sabha MP Imran Pratapgarhi said that the Bharat Jodo Yatra stopped religious polarisation in Telangana. He added that its success in Hyderabad shows people's vigilance about polarisation the BJP and TRS have created. "Rahul Gandhi's speech has removed the secular mask that K Chandrashekar Rao has been wearing since 2014," Pratapgarhi stated.

29.title: Ratan Tata-backed CashKaro.com raises ₹130 cr in Series C funding round
29.article_body: CashKaro.com, a cashback and coupons platform, has secured ₹130 crore in a Series C funding round led by Affle Global Pte Ltd. After the latest round, the company's total funds are over ₹225 crore from investors including Ratan Tata, Kalaari Capital, Korea Investment Partners and others. The company was founded by Swati Bhargava and Rohan Bhargava in April 2013.

30.title: Maharashtra government to develop 180-km Pune-Nashik expressway
30.article_body: Maharashtra government will develop a 180-km long expressway between Pune and Nashik to provide faster connectivity between Mumbai, Pune and Nashik, officials said. "There'll be flight landing and takeoff facilities on the expressway and emergency telephones at every five km," an MSRDC official said. It'll also have rest area at every 50 km and IT services including free wi-fi access.

31.title: Ishaan Khatter & me will always root for each other: Janhvi Kapoor
31.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor opened up about her upcoming film 'Mili' and Ishaan Khatter's 'Phone Bhoot' releasing on the same day. Janhvi said, "Ishaan messaged me...wishing me luck for 'Mili'...I wished him back saying, 'Right back at you!'." "We really wish the best for each other from the heart...A part of us will always root for each other," she stated.

32.title: Turkish Prez says he could discuss $8 charge for verified badge with Elon Musk
32.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan has said he may negotiate the monthly $8 charge for "verified" badge with Twitter's new boss Elon Musk. During an interview, Erdoğan said, "It might be different for us...We could carry out some diplomacy with him as well." After $44 billion Twitter buyout, Musk said the platform will charge $8 a month for "verified" badge.

33.title: 30 foreign nationals deported for overstaying in Delhi's Dwarka
33.article_body: As many as 30 foreign nationals were deported from the Dwarka area in Delhi, officials said on Thursday. Of the 30, 27 were Nigerian nationals, two were from Ivory Coast and one was Ivoirienne national. "They were found overstaying in India without a valid visa. They were produced before the FRRO who ordered their deportation," an official statement read.

34.title: Arrest me if I committed a crime that big: Soren on his ED summon
34.article_body: A day after being summoned by the Enforcement Directorate (ED), Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren asked the central probe agency to just arrest him if he had committed a crime that big. "I've been summoned by the ED today when I already have a programme in Chhattisgarh...Security near ED office has increased. Why are you scared of Jharkhandis?" he added.

35.title: Dubai's Burj Khalifa lights up for Shah Rukh's b'day, actor reacts
35.article_body: Dubai's Burj Khalifa was lit up with Shah Rukh Khan's name to celebrate his 57th birthday. Reacting to the video shared by Mohamed Ali Alabbar, developer of Burj Khalifa, Shah Rukh thanked the team for "putting me on top of the world every year". The building also displayed a 'Happy birthday Pathaan' and 'We love you' message for the actor.

36.title: Show KL Rahul's run out to those who don't believe in luck: Uthappa
36.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Robin Uthappa termed KL Rahul's direct hit that resulted in Bangladesh opener Litton Das being run out during the T20 World Cup 2022 match between India and Bangladesh as "incredible". "That runout upended the match and gave India...momentum when they had none," said Uthappa. "Those who don't believe in luck, show them...[the run out]," added Uthappa.

37.title: Meta tests feature to let creators make, sell NFTs on Instagram
37.article_body: Meta on Wednesday announced that it's testing a feature that will allow creators to make and sell non-fungible tokens (NFTs) on Instagram. It is also testing a feature through which viewers of Reels will be able to send virtual gifts to their favourite creators. Additionally, Meta said it's giving all eligible US creators access to Instagram Subscriptions.

38.title: Black belt Rahul Gandhi corrects child's karate techniques, video surfaces
38.article_body: Congress has shared a video from Rahul Gandhi's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in which he can be seen interacting with a karate kid. In the video, Gandhi, who's a black belt in Aikido, was seen supervising the deliveries of the kid and correcting his techniques. "If the technique is wrong, the country goes on to the path of destruction," Congress tweeted.

39.title: Russia summons British envoy over drone strike on its fleet in Crimea
39.article_body: Russia has summoned the British ambassador over Moscow's allegations that British navy personnel were involved in a drone attack on Russia's Black Sea Fleet in Crimea, which it blames on Ukraine. Ambassador Deborah Bronnert arrived at Russian Foreign Ministry and was inside for about 30 minutes. After the drone attack, Russia temporarily suspended participation in the Turkey-brokered grain deal.

40.title: Man kills alcoholic son with axe on granddaughter's birthday in Pune
40.article_body: A 55-year-old man allegedly killed his alcoholic son when the family was celebrating his granddaughter's birthday in Pune district's Pimpri-Chinchwad on Tuesday. Balu Baban Borkar, a labourer, allegedly killed Sameer with an axe when the latter came home in a drunken state. "Balu was…disappointed with his son's bad habits and fed up of spoiling [the]…birthday celebrations," a police official said.

41.title: BSc degree holder runs fake path lab in Gurugram, screens 700+ people; held
41.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar's Flying Squad and the state health department have jointly busted a fake pathology lab in Gurugram and seized 45 rapid test kits and other items. They have also arrested a man who had been running the fake lab for one year and screened over 750 people during this period. He only has a BSc degree.

42.title: WB CM Mamata seeks waiver of 20% customs duty on Gobindobhog rice, writes to PM
42.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday wrote a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi seeking an exemption of 20% customs duty on state's famed Gobindobhog rice. In the letter, Banerjee said that the duty on Gobindobhog should be exempted in a similar manner as Basmati rice. She added that the Centre's decision has negatively impacted Gobindobhog's export.

43.title: Close Delhi schools till air quality improves: NCPCR to Delhi govt
43.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) chairperson Priyank Kanoongo has asked the Delhi government to shut schools in the city until the air quality improves. "Air pollution of 'severe level' affects healthy people and seriously impacts children and those with existing diseases, according to CPCB," said Kanoongo in his letter.

44.title: K'taka govt instructs schools & PU colleges to introduce 10-min meditation session
44.article_body: Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh has directed the schools and pre-university colleges across the state to introduce a 10-minute 'dhyana' (meditation) session for students every day. Meditation would help students in increasing concentration, Nagesh tweeted while sharing the official order. "This will help students develop a positive attitude...and become good citizens," the order read.

45.title: NCB's Mumbai unit to get 2 highly-trained dogs to sniff out drug couriers
45.article_body: The Mumbai unit of Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) will soon have two highly-trained sniffer dogs to sniff out drug couriers. NCB was earlier reliant on sniffer dogs of customs department used at the airport and sniffer dogs of the Mumbai Police. "To be effective, they need to be specifically trained...which will be the case with...two sniffer dogs," an official said.

46.title: Pakistan's Iftikhar Ahmed smashes biggest six in Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup 2022
46.article_body: Pakistan's Iftikhar Ahmed on Thursday smashed the biggest six in Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup 2022. The 32-year-old smashed a 106-metre six on the bowling of South Africa pacer Lungi Ngidi in Pakistan's 16th over to achieve the feat. The previous biggest six (104 metres) in the Super 12 stage was slammed by David Miller against India.

47.title: GHMC to beautify Hyderabad flyovers with paintings, vertical gardens
47.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) is set to beautify flyovers with paintings and vertical gardens on pillars. "Extended Chandrayangutta flyover...and the under-construction Kothaguda flyover along with other Strategic Road Development Plan (SRDP) projects will have vertical gardens," a GHMC official said. Authorities will also install benches to utilise space under the flyovers.

48.title: Rajasthan BJP MP slaps government employee in public; video surfaces
48.article_body: BJP MP from Rajasthan's Chittorgarh, Chandra Prakash Joshi, slapped a government employee in public for allegedly demanding a bribe. A video of the incident, which happened at the Narcotics office in Pratapgarh, surfaced online. Joshi slapped the employee after farmers purportedly complained he had taken a bribe of ₹5,000 from them in the name of opium conversion and licence distribution.

49.title: Fire breaks out at godown in Pune's Sopan Nagar, no casualty reported
49.article_body: Fire broke out at a godown on Ahmednagar road in Pune's Sopan Nagar on Thursday. According to the Pune Fire Brigade, five fire tenders were rushed to the spot. No casualties have been reported in the incident so far and efforts to douse the blaze are currently going on. Further details about damages are awaited.

50.title: No time to pass order on Salman's plea in defamation case against neighbour: HC judge
50.article_body: Bombay High Court's Justice Chandrakant Bhadang said he wouldn't be able to pass an order on Salman Khan's plea in a defamation case against his neighbour due to lack of time before his retirement. He added that the appeal would be placed before another judge after the Diwali vacation. Salman had accused his neighbour of posting his derogatory videos online.

51.title: Sushmita always told me to prioritise my own happiness: Charu Asopa
51.article_body: Actress Charu Asopa said that Sushmita Sen never asked her to try and resolve the differences between her and her estranged husband Rajeev Sen. "She has never told us to work it out. She has always told me to prioritise my own happiness, from day one," Asopa said. Recently, Charu had accused Rajeev of physical violence and infidelity.

52.title: Porn addicted 16-yr-old rapes 15-yr-old girl in K'taka; strangles her
52.article_body: A 16-year-old has been arrested for raping and strangling a 15-year-old girl to death in Karnataka, police said on Thursday. The accused was addicted to porn and watched porn videos most of the time, police said. The incident took place on Tuesday when the deceased had gone to attend nature's call. The accused assaulted the girl in a sugarcane field.

53.title: India's services sector PMI rises to 55.1 in Oct after 6-month low in Sept
53.article_body: India's services sector activity surged to 55.1 in October from September's six-month low of 54.3, the S&P Global India Services Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) showed. The services PMI was above the neutral 50-mark for the 15th month in a row. According to the survey data, demand from the local Indian market was the key driver for services firms in October.

54.title: 48 including local BJP leader held guilty for 2002 riots in MP's Satna
54.article_body: A court sentenced 48 persons, including a local BJP leader, to seven years of imprisonment in the 2002 riots case in Madhya Pradesh's Satna. It held the accused guilty of rioting, voluntarily causing hurt to a public servant and other charges. The case pertains to an attack on the then SP, collector and others after a tribal died by suicide.

55.title: 3-year-old girl playing on a slide at Mumbai mall falls, dies
55.article_body: A three-and-a-half-year-old girl died after allegedly sustaining injuries while playing in the kids' zone of a shopping mall in Mumbai's Ghatkopar on Sunday. According to the police, Dalisha Verma sustained injuries on her head after she fell off while sliding down a slide at Neelyog Mall. An official said a CCTV footage showed there was no negligence or foul play.

56.title: Man climbs tree on not getting stall in Delhi, falls as branches break down
56.article_body: A 52-year-old Nepali national on Wednesday climbed a tree in Delhi's Sarojini Nagar market, complaining that he did not get a stall in the market despite repeated requests. However, the tree branches broke down suddenly and he fell on the net held by police and fire brigade staff. He is now being treated at the AIIMS Trauma centre.

57.title: 'Rahul ko hai bachana': BJP to Cong over '3 monkeys' reaction on Guj poll
57.article_body: Before the EC shared the official dates for the Gujarat polls on Thursday, Congress reacted with emoticons of 'three monkeys', who see no evil, hear no evil and speak no evil. Responding to Congress' tweet, BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla said, "ECI par nishana kyunki Rahul ko hai bachana." Gujarat polls will be held in two phases on December 1 and 5.

58.title: Institutions acting against corrupt need not be defensive: PM Modi
58.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said institutions acting against the corrupt and corruption need not be defensive while doing their work. PM Modi was addressing a programme marking Vigilance Awareness Week of the Central Vigilance Commission. "We have been trying to change the system made by ‘abhaav’ (lack) and ‘dabaav’ (pressure) in the last eight years," PM Modi added.

59.title: Ukraine urges citizens to not post details of missing Ukrainians on social media
59.article_body: Ukrainian government has urged citizens not to post information regarding missing soldiers and civilians on social media as it could help Russia identify valuable prisoners and track down people trying to avoid being captured. Ukraine's Deputy Defence Minister said publishing details of prisoners' personal lives, political views or social status could complicate process of securing their release.

60.title: Bikaji Foods raises ₹262 crore from anchor investors ahead of IPO
60.article_body: Bikaji Foods International has mobilised ₹262.11 crore from 36 anchor investors ahead of its initial public offering. The firm has allocated 87.37 lakh equity shares to anchor investors at ₹300 per share, aggregating the transaction size to ₹262.11 crore. The company said 36.83 lakh shares or 42.16% of anchor book were allocated to 10 domestic mutual funds through 17 schemes.

61.title: Journalist asks Shakib 'Were you discussing Bangladeshi rivers with umpire?'; video viral
61.article_body: During the press conference after India-Bangladesh match, a journalist asked Shakib Al Hasan, "Were you discussing Bangladeshi rivers with the umpire?" The journalist asked this after questioning Shakib for not convincing umpire to not play after the rain. A video of the same went viral. Shakib explained to him that the discussion with the umpire was regarding the revised target.

62.title: Mumbai Traffic Police share post on seat belt safety with 'Pathaan' reference
62.article_body: Mumbai Traffic Police took to Twitter on Wednesday and shared a clip from the teaser of Shah Rukh Khan's 'Pathaan' to spread awareness about seat belt safety. In the clip, Shah Rukh can be heard saying, "Put on your seat belt." Along with the clip, Mumbai Traffic Police tweeted, "'Jab tak hai jaan', listen to this sound advice."

63.title: Foreign currency worth ₹4 cr seized from Dubai-bound passengers' saree, shoes in Mumbai
63.article_body: Customs at Mumbai's International Airport seized foreign currency worth more than ₹4 crore concealed in saree and shoes in luggage of a family of three Indian passengers departing to Dubai. The family had two elderly passengers and one other male passenger. The three passengers have been arrested and have been sent to judicial custody.

64.title: Bouncers assault forest official, his friends outside Gurugram club
64.article_body: Forest department employee, Dev Kumar, has alleged that bouncers assaulted him and his friends at a club in Gurugram, police said. Kumar alleged that bouncers attacked him and his friends while waiting for a friend, who had gone inside the club to retrieve his phone. Assault was stopped when the manager of another club intervened, Kumar added.

65.title: B'luru man chops off 21-yr-old's hand as he objects to throwing tissue
65.article_body: A man allegedly chopped off a 21-year-old youth's left hand and right thumb in Bengaluru after he objected to him and his friends over throwing tissue paper on his table. Police have booked the man and his friends. Meanwhile, the victim's severed hand and thumb were reported missing from the crime scene and police suspect dogs might have eaten them.

66.title: 4 of a family from Hyderabad killed after bus hits car in Andole
66.article_body: A family of four people, including a one-year-old infant, died in a road accident at Kamsanpalle in Andole. The family hailed from Quthubullapur in Hyderabad. The incident reportedly occurred after a bus driver had hit their Maruti 800 car due to low visibility in morning, killing all four persons on the spot. The bodies were shifted to a government hospital.

67.title: Mohanlal's 'Barroz' not based on my script anymore: Writer Jijo Punnoose
67.article_body: Writer Jijo Punnoose revealed that 'Barroz' isn't based on his script anymore. He said that Mohanlal has "fashioned the screenplay and the character of Barroz...to satisfy his fan base". The writer added that since his script is no longer being used for the Mohanlal film, he and his team would make the film in English/Hispanic as per their initial plans.

68.title: Congress in self-destruction mode, has no future: Kuldeep Bishnoi
68.article_body: BJP leader Kuldeep Bishnoi on Thursday said Congress is in "self-destruction mode" and has no future. The former Congress leader, Bishnoi, added that Rahul Gandhi is conducting the "padyatra" to save his own reputation. "If Rahul Gandhi wants to do political suicide, he can. I cannot do that by being in Congress," Bishnoi stated.

69.title: Tiger Global, Sequoia-backed unicorn Chargebee fires 100 employees
69.article_body: Tiger Global and Sequoia-backed revenue management startup Chargebee has laid off around 100 employees, citing adverse macroeconomic factors. "This difficult decision was driven by...our need to address the operational debt...accumulated in last few years," CEO Krish Subramanian said. The layoffs come nine months after the unicorn raised $250 million which doubled its valuation to $3.5 billion.

70.title: Gokhale bridge in Mumbai's Andheri to be shut for 2 years
70.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to shut down the Gokhale bridge to all vehicular traffic for a minimum of two years. The bridge, a part of which collapsed in 2018, killing two, is a key connector between Andheri east and west. The BMC has also written to the traffic police to draw up alternative routes for commuters.

71.title: Ex-Miss Barbados claims Miss World 2000 was 'rigged' to favour Priyanka, posts video
71.article_body: A YouTuber and former Miss Barbados 2000 alleged that the Miss World pageant of 2000, which Priyanka Chopra won, was "rigged". Leilani McConney said the show was sponsored by ZeeTV, an Indian cable station, and alleged that Priyanka was 'favoured'. Leilani claimed in her video that Priyanka's gowns were better made and she was even allowed food in her room.

72.title: Who are the ICC Player of the Month nominees for October as 3 Indians included?
72.article_body: The ICC on Thursday announced the Player of the Month nominees for the month of October. South Africa's David Miller, India's Virat Kohli and Zimbabwe's Sikandar Raza have been nominated for ICC Men's Player of the Month award, while India's Jemimah Rodrigues and Deepti Sharma, and Pakistan's Nida Dar have been nominated for the women's category.

73.title: Virat Kohli gets nominated for ICC Player of the Month award for the first time ever
73.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli has been nominated for the ICC Men's Player of the Month award for the first time since the award's inception. Kohli amassed 205 T20I runs in October at an average of 205 and a strike-rate of 150.73. So far, four Indians have bagged the ICC Men's Player of the Month award.

74.title: WhatsApp announces new features including in-chat polls, groups with up to 1024 users
74.article_body: Meta-owned messaging platform WhatsApp on Thursday announced several new features. The platform will roll out features including Communities on WhatsApp, in-chat polls, 32-person video calling, groups with up to 1024 users. WhatsApp said, "Just like emoji reactions, larger file sharing, and admin delete, these features can be used in any group but will be particularly helpful for Communities."

75.title: Ex-Navy chief Admiral Ramdas joins Rahul for Bharat Jodo Yatra in T’gana
75.article_body: Former Navy chief Admiral L Ramdas joined Congress leader Rahul Gandhi during the Bharat Jodo Yatra in Telangana on Thursday. "Admiral Ramdas…who at 89 continues to be an indefatigable campaigner for public causes, along with his wife Lalita Ramdas…walked with Rahul Gandhi on day 57 of Bharat Jodo Yatra," Congress’ Jairam Ramesh tweeted.

76.title: 9-yr-old Bengaluru boy wins World Youth Scrabble Tournament
76.article_body: A nine-year-old Bengaluru boy, Samarth Manchali, has been declared the best under-10 player in World Youth Scrabble Championship-2022. Samarth is a resident of Vidyaranyapura and student of MES Kishora Kendra school. Two other players from India also made it into the top 10 players list of the global virtual tournament, the Scrabble Association of India announced.

77.title: FM Sitharaman calls 'Kantara' a well-made film, praises Rishab Shetty
77.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman called 'Kantara' a "well-made" film, which "captures the rich traditions of Tuluvanadu and Karavali". Sitharaman, who watched the Kannada film in Bengaluru on Wednesday, also praised the film's director-writer Rishab Shetty. Recently, politician Piyush Goyal also spoke about the Kannada film and how it has "grossed nearly 20 times its investment".

78.title: Babar isn't capable of being the anchor, aggressor like Kohli: Gambhir
78.article_body: Gautam Gambhir has said Virat Kohli is one of the "very few" players who has the ability to play the role of an anchor as well as an aggressor. "Kane Williamson, Steve Smith, Joe Root and Babar Azam don't have that ability," added Gambhir. Kohli was named Player of the Match in India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Bangladesh.

79.title: 4 booked, 1 arrested for trying to extort ₹65 lakh from builder in Pune
79.article_body: Pune City Police booked four persons and arrested another for allegedly trying to extort ₹65 lakh from a builder. "One of the accused has been arrested and search is on for others," police said. The builder had taken a loan of ₹1.85 crore from the accused and returned ₹2.3 crore but they were still demanding ₹65 lakh more, police added.

80.title: Ex-housekeeper sues Bezos over racial bias, 'unsanitary' working conditions at his home
80.article_body: Jeff Bezos has been sued by a former housekeeper who alleged that she was subjected to racial discrimination by his staff and forced to work long hours in unsanitary conditions at his Seattle home. According to Mercedes Wedaa's complaint, she sometimes worked 10-14 hours per day and the staff didn't have a designated break room or an easily accessible restroom.

81.title: 'Pathaan' is a cool action film like 'Mission Impossible': SRK
81.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan said that his upcoming film 'Pathaan' is a "cool action film" like 'Mission Impossible'. "I've always wanted to do something like 'Mission Impossible', cool action film. I think 'Pathaan' is like that," he said. The actor added that 'Pathaan' and his other upcoming releases, 'Dunki' and 'Jawan', are films that he's never attempted before.

82.title: Bangladesh lost the game rather than India winning it: Sunil Gavaskar
82.article_body: Talking about India's win in their T20 World Cup 2022 match against Bangladesh, Sunil Gavaskar said, "Bangladesh lost the game rather than India winning...[it]." "Bangladesh...panicked and tried to play too many glory shots...They tried to hit a six...every ball," added Gavaskar. "If Bangladesh had played smart cricket...they would've got 10 runs an over and that's all...they needed," he stated.

83.title: Thieves steal transceivers from mobile tower in Gurugram; network affected
83.article_body: Four radio transceivers were stolen from a mobile tower in Gurugram's Sector 30, affecting cellular network in the area for several hours last month, the police said. Similar thefts were also reported from other areas, police added. A remote radio unit costs about ₹1.75 lakh and is a sophisticated instrument that can receive and send high-frequency radio waves, investigators said.

84.title: Groom crushes aunt to death while test driving car gifted by bride's family in UP
84.article_body: A groom mowed down his aunt with a car gifted by the bride's family in Uttar Pradesh's Etawah district. Reports said that the groom did not know how to drive, but went for a test drive. He accelerated the car and rammed into his relatives killing his aunt and seriously injuring four others.

85.title: Messi said 'I've been thinking about 2014 WC final for a yr': Ex-agent
85.article_body: Recalling a conversation he had with Lionel Messi in 2015, Messi's former agent Fabian Soldini said, "Messi told me, 'I've been waking up at night thinking about 2014 World Cup final...for a year. I can't sleep'." "It goes round and round in his head," added Soldini. "His great love is Argentina...It is neither Barcelona nor Newell's Old Boys," he stated.

86.title: Voting for Gujarat Assembly elections in 2 phases on Dec 1 and 5; results on Dec 8
86.article_body: Election Commission of India (ECI) announced that voting for the 2022 Gujarat Assembly elections will take place in two phases on December 1 and December 5. The counting of votes will take place on December 8. A total of 51,782 polling stations will be set up, ECI said. The term of the 182-member state Assembly ends on February 18, 2023.

87.title: Russia could quit grain deal again but won't block grain for Turkey: Putin
87.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said that Russia has the right to withdraw again from the grain deal but wouldn't prevent grain shipment to Turkey. On Saturday, Moscow pulled out of the UN and Turkey-brokered deal after an attack on its fleet in the Black Sea. The decision was overturned after phone call between Putin and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan.

88.title: India reports 1,321 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 16,098
88.article_body: India reported 1,321 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 1,190 fresh COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 16,098. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,30,461, according to the ministry.

89.title: Punjab records season's highest daily farm fires at 3,634
89.article_body: Punjab witnessed 3,634 farm fires on Wednesday, the highest number of stubble burning incidents so far this season, according to data from Punjab Remote Sensing Centre. Out of total 3,634 farm fire incidents, Sangrur reported 677 cases, the highest number in the state. The cumulative farm fire cases from September 15 to November 2 reached 21,480.

90.title: SC upholds death penalty for LeT terrorist Mohammad Arif in 2000 Red Fort attack case
90.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday dismissed a review petition filed by LeT terrorist Mohammad Arif against the death penalty awarded to him in connection with the 2000 Red Fort attack case. Three people, including two Army personnel, were killed in the attack. The petition was heard by a bench comprising CJI UU Lalit and Justice Bela M Trivedi.

91.title: 2 killed, 8 injured as bus collides with tanker in Agra
91.article_body: At least two persons were killed and eight others were injured as a bus collided with a tanker in Uttar Pradesh's Agra on Thursday, police said. "The roadways bus...was coming to Agra from Firozabad. There were around 30-35 passengers on it," Etmadpur Circle Officer Ravi Kumar Gupta said. The driver of the bus fell asleep while driving, the passengers claimed.

92.title: It's my best win: Paul after beating Nadal in Paris Masters 2nd round
92.article_body: American tennis player Tommy Paul termed defeating Rafael Nadal in the second round of the Paris Masters 2022 as his "best win", adding that he was "pretty relaxed" before the match. Nadal has been knocked out of the Paris Masters before the quarterfinals for the first time in his career. Paul recorded a 3-6, 7-6(4), 6-1 win against Nadal.

93.title: Thieves rob house in Ghaziabad, use newspaper to check if family not at home
93.article_body: A gang of thieves stole cash, jewellery from a house in Ghaziabad's Avantika phase 2 when the family went to visit Vaishno Devi. On finding that their house has been robbed, they saw newspaper lying outside house and said that they have not subscribed to any newspaper and thieves have used it to check if anyone was present in house.

94.title: 7-yr-old boy suffers 7 heart attacks after being stung by scorpion in Brazil; dies
94.article_body: A seven-year-old boy from Brazil suffered seven heart attacks after he was stung by a Brazilian yellow scorpion while preparing for a camping trip. The boy passed away two days after he was bitten by the yellow Scorpion also known as Tityus Serrulatus. The Tityus Serrulatus is blamed for thousands of deaths in the country.

95.title: Centre’s goal is to make Delhi grand city with all facilities: PM Modi
95.article_body: The Centre’s goal is to make Delhi a grand city fitted with all facilities expected of the country’s capital, PM Narendra Modi said on Wednesday. His statement came as he inaugurated 3,024 newly constructed flats to house slum dwellers in Delhi’s Kalkaji. "Now the poor is at the centre of our government’s policies as it is their dispensation," PM added.

96.title: Lodha Villa Royale, Palava is a rare chance to own land in MMR: Lodha
96.article_body: Lodha has launched villa plots in Lodha Villa Royale, Palava, sharing that there is an ultimate sense of pride, exclusivity and success in villa ownership. The 250-600 sq yd villa plots lie with a serene lake, tree-lined avenues, wide open spaces, and like-minded neighbourhood of residents who have chosen to live on their own terms, on their own land, it added.

97.title: Jaya loves fish, I've stopped eating non-veg: Amitabh Bachchan
97.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan, during the latest episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14', shared that his wife Jaya Bachchan loves to eat fish, while he has stopped eating non-veg. In a conversation with a contestant, Bachchan said he had recently quit eating sweets, rice and paan as well. On the work front, Amitabh Bachchan's next release is Sooraj Barjatya's 'Uunchai'.

98.title: Putin calls for modernisation of weapons used by Russian military
98.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said that weapons used by the Russian military should be modernised. "Weapons must constantly, continuously improve and remain effective. To achieve this...it is important to ensure that there is active competition between manufacturers and developers," Putin added. Iran is preparing to send approximately 1,000 additional weapons to Russia, a CNN report said.

99.title: Difficult to imagine, I've never won it: Nadal on winning ATP Finals
99.article_body: Rafael Nadal said it's "difficult" for him to imagine winning the upcoming edition of the ATP Finals having failed to win a single edition of the tournament so far in his career. "[The last] couple of months...[haven't been perfect]," added Nadal. Nadal was recently knocked out in the second round of the Paris Masters following a defeat against Tommy Paul.

100.title: Reopened bridge with temporary repairs: Oreva Group's letter to Morbi collector in 2020
100.article_body: A letter sent by the Oreva Group to the District Collector of Gujarat's Morbi in January 2020 said, "We're reopening the suspension bridge by only doing temporary repairs." As per the contents of the letter, the firm demanded a permanent contract for the bridge's maintenance. The firm bagged a 15-year contract for the maintenance of the bridge in March 2022.

101.title: What does the law say about 'fake fielding' which Virat Kohli is accused of doing?
101.article_body: During Bangladesh's seventh over, Virat Kohli mimed a throw at non-striker's end despite not having the ball. As per cricket laws, it's unfair for fielders wilfully to attempt, by word or action, to distract, deceive or obstruct batters after striker has received the ball. Further, it's for umpires to decide whether any distraction, deception or obstruction is wilful or not.

102.title: 2 staffers dead, 1 critical as fire breaks out at hotel in UP's Vrindavan
102.article_body: At least two staffers died and one was critically injured as a fire broke out at a hotel in Vrindavan in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura on Thursday, officials said. "It was found there was a fire in the (kitchen) store room," a fire official said. "There were around 100 guests staying in the hotel...all of them were evacuated," the official added.

103.title: Playing Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj is a huge responsibility: Akshay
103.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar said he was taken aback when politician Raj Thackeray asked him to portray Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in the upcoming Marathi film 'Vedat Marathe Veer Daudale Saat'. "I think to portray Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj on the big screen is a very huge responsibility...It's going to be a dream come true role for me," he shared.

104.title: 6 Mumbai Metro stations to provide direct access to pvt properties: Report
104.article_body: Six underground stations along the Colaba-Bandra-SEEPZ metro rail have been identified to provide direct subway access to private properties along the route, reports said. The stations reportedly being considered to provide direct access subway are - Marol Naka, BKC, Dharavi, Dadar, Worli and Science Museum. Once implemented, Aqua line will become first metro service in India to have such access.

105.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro urges supporters to lift road blockades after election loss
105.article_body: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro has requested his supporters to lift road blockades as demonstrations are restricting people's movement and bringing losses to the economy. Protests erupted after Bolsonaro lost to leftist Lula da Silva in the Presidential election. In a video, Bolsonaro said, "I know you are upset...Me too. But we have to keep our heads straight...clear the highways."

106.title: Suryakumar points to 'India' written on jersey, urges fans to chant it; video viral
106.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav pointing to 'India' written on his jersey and urging fans to chant it while he was fielding in the deep against Bangladesh in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Wednesday. The ICC also shared the video, writing, "Indian and proud!" India beat Bangladesh by five runs (DLS method).

107.title: 36-year-old Shikhar Dhawan appointed captain of Punjab Kings
107.article_body: Punjab Kings have appointed Shikhar Dhawan as their captain for the upcoming season of IPL. The 36-year-old opener will take over from Mayank Agarwal, who was appointed captain ahead of IPL 2022. Earlier this year, Kings spent ₹8.25 crore to buy Dhawan in the auction. Dhawan will be the 14th captain to lead Punjab Kings.

108.title: I am convinced with his run out, but not his 50: Sehwag on KL Rahul
108.article_body: Discussing KL Rahul's performance in India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Bangladesh, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said, "I am convinced with his run out [which resulted in the dismissal of Litton Das] but not [his] 50." "Rahul should have scored a hundred because he didn't score in the last few matches," added Sehwag. Rahul scored 50 off 32 balls.

109.title: North Korea again fires multiple missiles
109.article_body: A day after firing at least 23 missiles into the sea, North Korea on Thursday fired multiple ballistic missiles, including a possible failed intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM). Warnings were sent to residents of a South Korean island and people in parts of northern Japan to seek shelter. South Korea's military said it is maintaining a "full readiness posture".

110.title: Properties worth ₹19.57 crore of drug kingpin seized in Mumbai
110.article_body: Mumbai Police's Anti-Narcotics Cell seized properties worth ₹19.57 crore owned by alleged drug kingpin Premprakash Singh. "Since 2019, he had purchased nine godowns, two flats...these investments were made after he got into the drug trade in 2018," an official said. Singh is the main accused in the case in which 2,428 kilograms of mephedrone worth ₹4,856 crore was seized.

111.title: Uber's current business model absolutely unsustainable: Whistleblower
111.article_body: Mark MacGann, the whistleblower behind 'The Uber Files' leak, on Wednesday said that the company has taken steps to improve its work culture, but its business model is still "absolutely" unsustainable. In July, MacGann revealed himself as the source who leaked over 124,000 internal files of Uber. Leaked documents showed how Uber secretly lobbied politicians to expand into new markets.

112.title: Didn't make any decision: L'Oréal on report it suspended Twitter ad spending
112.article_body: L'Oréal has denied a Financial Times report that said the cosmetics company suspended advertising spending on Twitter. The company told Reuters that it didn't make any such decision. Last week, General Motors said it has temporarily paused paid advertising on Twitter and is working to understand the platform's direction under the ownership of Elon Musk.

113.title: Some Twitter employees are calling Musk's advisers 'Elon's goons': Report
113.article_body: Some Twitter employees are calling Elon Musk's team of advisers "Elon's goons" after his takeover, as per a report. As per another report, many Twitter employees have stopped using the company's internal systems to talk about workplace issues, while some of Twitter's Slack channels are almost silent. Musk has reportedly brought 50 employees from his other companies to Twitter.

114.title: We're almost there but never cross the line against India: Shakib
114.article_body: Discussing Bangladesh's defeat by five runs in their T20 World Cup 2022 match against India, Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan said, "It's been the story when we play India. We're almost there but [never] cross the line." "Our plan was to get India's top-order quickly...Unfortunately, Taskin Ahmed couldn't get wickets," added Shakib. "In the end...someone has to lose," he stated.

115.title: US Justice Dept plans to probe Adobe's $20 bn Figma deal: Report
115.article_body: The US Department of Justice is reportedly preparing to launch an investigation into Adobe's $20 billion deal to acquire online design startup Figma. The authorities have been contacting customers and competitors of both companies, Politico reported. "We're engaged in productive discussions with regulators to ensure they have a full understanding of the combination," Adobe said.

116.title: The Sleep Company raises ₹177 cr in Series B round led by Premji Invest, others
116.article_body: The Sleep Company, a D2C mattress startup, has secured ₹177 crore in a Series B funding round led by Wipro's venture capital arm Premji Invest and Fireside Ventures. Venture debt firm Alteria Capital also participated. The Sleep Company was founded in 2019 by Priyanka Salot and Harshil Salot. Last year, the startup raised ₹13.4 crore in pre-Series A funding round.

117.title: Non-reporting of sexual assault against minor a serious crime: SC
117.article_body: The Supreme Court said that non-reporting of sexual assault against a minor despite knowledge is a "serious crime" and an attempt to shield the offenders. The court said prompt and proper reporting of the commission of offence under POCSO Act is of utmost importance and the failure to do so would defeat the very purpose and object of the law.

118.title: Thick smog, low visibility across Delhi-NCR; air quality turns 'severe'
118.article_body: Thick smog in Delhi led to low visibility in the city on Thursday morning as Air Quality Index (AQI) crossed 400-mark to remain in 'severe' category in parts of the national capital. Meanwhile, the AQI in Noida was recorded at 393 and in Gurugram it was at 318 on Thursday morning. AQI between 401 and 500 is categorised as 'severe'.

119.title: The moment I try to be relevant that will be my end: Sooraj Barjatya
119.article_body: Director Sooraj Barjatya said that the moment he'd try to be relevant, it will mark the end of his time as a filmmaker. "If I try to be relevant, I will be fake," Sooraj said, adding that he's happy making family dramas, a genre he's well known for. The director called his films the "aspirational" version of his life.

120.title: SolarSquare raises ₹100 crore in Series A funding round
120.article_body: SolarSquare, a B2C rooftop solar startup, has secured ₹100 crore in Series A funding round led by Elevation Capital and Lowercarbon. Existing investors Good Capital and Rainmatter and angel investors including Meesho co-founders Vidit Aatrey and Sanjeev Barnwal also participated. SolarSquare was founded by IIT Bombay alumni Neeraj Jain, Shreya Mishra and former Panasonic executive Nikhil Nahar.

121.title: Police seize ₹1.27 crore hawala money in Hyderabad, 3 arrested
121.article_body: The Commissioner’s Task Force (central) team busted a hawala racket in Hyderabad on Tuesday and seized  ₹1.27 crore. Three persons involved in the case were arrested. Police found the unaccounted cash during the checking of a two-wheeler at Himayat Nagar. The arrested persons along with seized cash were handed over to Narayanaguda Police Station for further action.

122.title: Elon Musk shares memes to defend his decision to charge $8 for Twitter blue tick
122.article_body: Amid criticism over his decision to charge $8/month for Twitter's blue tick, Elon Musk shared memes  to defend his move. He shared a meme where people are happy to pay $8 for a Starbucks coffee but won't pay for a verification tick on Twitter. He also shared another photo of a sweatshirt priced at $58.

123.title: Transformer in Chikhali being shifted for traffic, not for CM's visit: PCMC
123.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) clarified that the transformer near the newly-constructed Chikhali water treatment plant was not being removed for Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's visit. "The transformer is being removed to ensure smooth movement of traffic on the road. It has no link to the proposed inauguration function," Municipal Commissioner Shekhar Singh said.

124.title: Your safety is never a joke: Mumbai Police on comedian's joke about city's seat belt rule
124.article_body: Comedian Atul Khatri took to Twitter on Tuesday to share a photo of a model wearing a t-shirt with a seat belt printed on it and said, "Mumbaikars! Please wear seat belts from today or buy this t-shirt." Meanwhile, Mumbai Police responded, "We shall keep them in stock for you, along with our challans. Your safety is never a joke!"

125.title: Kerala judge's transfer over 'sexually provocative' dress remark quashed
125.article_body: Kerala High Court has quashed the transfer of the Kozhikode district sessions judge who had recently made the "sexually provocative" dress remark. While granting anticipatory bail to social activist Civic Chandran in a sexual harassment case, the judge had said that the offence under IPC Section 354A is not prima facie attracted if the woman is wearing "sexually provocative dresses".

126.title: Don't lose yourself in relationship: Ishaan on Shahid's advice for him
126.article_body: Actor Ishaan Khatter was recently asked to share the best relationship advice he received from his brother Shahid Kapoor. "My brother has told me not to lose myself in a relationship; to always know who I am...That's very good advice," Khatter said in response. Ishaan, who had previously mentioned that he's currently single, was rumoured to be dating Ananya Panday.

127.title: Would google or call Salman bhai, Tiger for tips: SRK on his fitness during COVID-19
127.article_body: During an event on his 57th birthday, Shah Rukh Khan spoke about his fitness routine during the COVID-19 pandemic. He said, "Once I woke up, I'd go to the gym for 30-45 mins, where no trainer was allowed due to quarantine. So I'd google the exercises that I could do or would call Salman bhai, Tiger and Hrithik for suggestions."

128.title: AC Milan enter CL round of 16 for the first time in 9 years
128.article_body: AC Milan entered the round of 16 stage in the ongoing season of the Champions League, following a 4-0 win against RB Salzburg. Olivier Giroud scored a brace as Milan entered the knockout phase in an edition of the tournament for the first time in nine years. Chelsea and Manchester City also recorded wins against Dinamo Zagreb and Sevilla respectively.

129.title: Declare Hesaraghatta grasslands as conservation reserve: B'luru residents
129.article_body: A proposal demanding recognition of Hesaraghatta grasslands as a conservation reserve has been signed by 75,000 Bengaluru residents and was handed over to the Principal Chief Conservator of Forests Vijayakumar Gogi. Meanwhile, the State Board for Wildlife will hold a meeting regarding the 5,000 acres grasslands today. The grasslands is located over 40 km away from Bengaluru.

130.title: Pune City Police raids 2 illegal rooftop hookah parlours in Kondhwa
130.article_body: The Crime Branch of the Pune City Police on Tuesday raided two rooftop restaurants in Kondhwa for running illegal hookah parlours. Police raided the restaurants, where customers were allegedly being served hookah, following a tip-off and booked two persons. Hookah pots and flavoured tobacco material estimated to be worth ₹65,210 were seized from the restaurants.

131.title: Bangladesh's Nurul Hasan accuses Virat Kohli of 'fake fielding'
131.article_body: Bangladesh wicketkeeper-batter Nurul Hasan has accused Virat Kohli of 'fake fielding' during India-Bangladesh T20 World Cup 2022 match. "There was...a fake throw. It could've been a five-run penalty," Nurul stated. He was referring to Kohli miming a relay throw at non-striker's end despite not having the ball in Bangladesh's seventh over. India won the match by five runs (DLS method).

132.title: Kanye paid settlement to ex-worker who claimed he praised Hitler in meetings: Report
132.article_body: Kanye West reportedly paid a settlement to a former employee over allegations that he praised Hitler and Nazis during business meetings. As per a report, while West denied the claims, other former employees said there were numerous instances where the rapper used anti-semitic language. Notably, several companies like Gap and Adidas have cut ties with West over his anti-semitic remarks.

133.title: Elon Musk responds to US politician Alexandria's tweet on his $8 charge for blue tick
133.article_body: Elon Musk has responded after US politician Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez tweeted, "Lmao at a billionaire earnestly trying to sell people on the idea that 'free speech' is actually a $8/month subscription plan." "Your feedback is appreciated, now pay $8," Musk responded. Earlier, Musk tweeted, "To all complainers, please continue complaining, but it will cost $8."

134.title: 5 Uzbek women go missing from shelter home in Delhi's Dwarka
134.article_body: At least five of seven Uzbek women, rescued from a sex trafficking racket by Delhi Police in August, went missing from a shelter home in Dwarka. "We knew they were in danger...had informed local police several times over the phone," a private NGO official claimed. The women were brought to India via Nepal and forced into sex work, police said.

135.title: Elon Musk planning to cut half of Twitter's workforce: Report
135.article_body: Elon Musk plans to cut about 3,700 jobs or half of Twitter's workforce in a bid to cut costs, Bloomberg News reported, citing people familiar with the matter. Musk will inform the staff affected on Friday, the report added. Musk also intends to reverse the social media company's existing work from anywhere policy, the report further said.

136.title: Election Commission to announce Gujarat Assembly election dates today
136.article_body: The Election Commission will announce the dates for the Gujarat Assembly election today. Last month, the schedule for the Himachal Pradesh Assembly election was announced, with voting set to begin on November 12 and counting to take place on December 8. According to ECI sources, voting in Gujarat may be held in two phases in the first week of December.

137.title: Voting begins for Assembly by-polls in Bihar, Maharashtra, H'yana, T'gana, UP and Odisha
137.article_body: Voting has begun for Assembly by-polls in seven vacant seats across six states. Voting is being held for Mokama and Gopalganj seats in Bihar, Andheri (East) in Maharashtra, Adampur in Haryana, Munugode in Telangana, Gola Gokarannath in Uttar Pradesh and Dhamnagar in Odisha. The counting of votes for all these seats will be held on Sunday.

138.title: US Federal Reserve hikes interest rates by 0.75% for the 4th time in a row
138.article_body: The US Federal Reserve System on Wednesday raised its benchmark interest rate by 0.75% for the fourth straight time. The move will raise its key rate to a range of 3.75% to 4%, the highest since January 2008. Further, this is the sixth time this year that the Fed has raised its key rate.

139.title: Kohli breaks Sachin's record for scoring most runs by an Indian in a country outside India
139.article_body: Virat Kohli has broken Sachin Tendulkar's record for scoring most international runs by an India batter in a country outside India. With his 64*(44) against Bangladesh in Adelaide today, Kohli took his tally of international runs in Australia to 3,350. He overtook Sachin, who scored 3,300 runs in Australia. Sachin's 2,686-run tally in Sri Lanka comes third on the list.

140.title: Cong election body to meet on Nov 4, finalise candidates for Guj polls
140.article_body: Congress Central Election Committee is set to meet on November 4 to finalise candidates for the Gujarat Assembly elections. The meeting will be held at the party headquarters in Delhi. Congress had put up a strong fight in the last Assembly polls. The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has announced the names of more than 100 candidates for the upcoming elections.

141.title: US FDA points out manufacturing lapses at Lupin's Tarapur API plant
141.article_body: US Food and Drug Administration (US FDA) has pointed out various manufacturing lapses at drug maker Lupin's Tarapur plant in Thane, which produces active pharmaceutical ingredients (API). In a warning letter, FDA said the plant failed to establish adequate written procedures for cleaning equipment. The health regulator inspected the plant from March 22 to April 4, 2022.

142.title: Pigs lick utensils at govt-run canteen in Rajasthan; video surfaces
142.article_body: A video showing pigs licking utensils meant to serve the poor at a government-run canteen in Rajasthan's Bharatpur has surfaced online. The plates that pigs were licking were designated for the poor under the Congress-led government's Indira Rasoi Yojana. Bharatpur Municipal Corporation (BMC) has terminated the contract with the organisation that was operating the canteen and has issued a notice.

143.title: Akali Dal suspends Jagir Kaur over "anti-party" activities
143.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) suspended Jagir Kaur, the first woman chief of the gurdwara committee, from the party on Wednesday over "anti-party activities". SAD disciplinary committee chairman Sikander Singh Maluka said the party had received complaints that Jagir was pressuring party members to support her for the post of Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee president against the party's wish.

144.title: UP CM Yogi demotes DSP for taking bribe to suppress gang-rape case
144.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has reportedly demoted Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP) Vidya Kishore Sharma. He was suspended in December 2021 after a video of him accepting ₹5 lakh bribe to suppress a gang-rape case in Rampur, where he was posted as DSP, went viral. An investigation into the matter has found Sharma guilty.

145.title: Woman of Pak origin arrested in Bihar while trying to sneak into Nepal
145.article_body: An American national of Pakistani origin was arrested in Bihar's Kishanganj district while trying to sneak into Nepal without valid documents, police said. Investigations revealed that Farida Mallik, who carried an American passport, is a resident of California. Mallik confessed to have travelled to Nepal via India a number of times and was once put in jail for the same.

146.title: Germany considering plan to levy charge on single-use plastic
146.article_body: The German government on Wednesday said it is planning to levy a charge on the manufacturers of single-use plastic products. According to a draft law, the funds acquired would be used to cover the costs of municipalities in clearing up litter. "With the new law, we are counteracting the waste of resources and environmental pollution," said Environment Minister Steffi Lemke.

147.title: Concerned about the safety of Chinese workers in Pakistan: China
147.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Wednesday expressed "deep concern" to Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif over the safety of Chinese nationals working in Pakistan on the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor projects. Sharif is on a two-day official visit to China. Sharif has become the first head of government to felicitate Xi, after he secured an unprecedented third term in office.

148.title: Fans erect 30-foot-tall cutout of Lionel Messi in middle of river in Kerala, pic viral
148.article_body: A picture has gone viral on social media showing a 30-foot-tall cutout of Argentina forward Lionel Messi being erected in the middle of a river in Kerala. The cutout was put up by an Argentina fan club of Pullavoor. A video had also surfaced online showing several fans carrying the cutout on a road.

149.title: Election battle 'is over': Brazil’s Bolsonaro to SC members
149.article_body: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro has told some members of the Supreme Court (SC) that his election battle against President-elect Lula da Silva 'is over'. Earlier, Bolsonaro did not concede defeat, as his supporters blocked highways and some called for a military coup. According to Supreme Court Justice Luiz Edson Fachin, Bolsonaro said, "It is over. So, let's look ahead."

150.title: Russia has agreed to the resumption of grain export: Turkish Prez
150.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on Wednesday said Russia has agreed to allow the export of Ukrainian grain via a route in the Black Sea. Russia last week suspended the shipments, as it alleged a drone attack was thwarted on Crimea. Erdogan said Russia's Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu had informed his Turkish counterpart regarding the go-ahead for grain export.

151.title: Chennai woman falls into open manhole, video shows people pulling her out
151.article_body: A 24-year-old woman fell into an open manhole constructed for laying a stormwater drain in Chennai's Perambur area on Wednesday. A video of the incident that surfaced online showed people rushing to the manhole and pulling the woman out. The manhole was not visible as the road was waterlogged following heavy rains.

152.title: Elon Musk says Twitter won't restore banned accounts without 'clear process'
152.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk on Wednesday said the platform will not allow anyone who was de-platformed for violating its rules "back on platform until we have a clear process for doing so". Musk added the process would take at least a few more weeks. "Twitter's content moderation council will include representatives with widely divergent views," he further added.

153.title: 3.5 lakh lost jobs in Ballari jeans industry due to note ban, GST: Cong
153.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday claimed that 3.5 lakh people working in the jeans industry in Karnataka's Ballari lost their jobs due to note ban (demonetisation) and "faulty" implementation of GST. The MP further noted that government-owned companies are in constant fear of privatisation. He added, "[Modi government aims] to create panic so that farmers and labourers are scared."

154.title: We made a mistake: Ex-reporter of The Wire on BJP-Meta reports
154.article_body: The Wire's ex-reporter Devesh Kumar admitted on Wednesday that the news portal was at fault regarding its reports that accused Facebook's parent company Meta of according special privileges to BJP IT Cell. "We made a mistake in reporting...A lot of documents we received...were false," Kumar said. This comes after The Wire accused Kumar of providing forged documents for the reports.

155.title: Need time to provide minority tag to Hindus in some states: Centre to SC
155.article_body: The Centre has asked the Supreme Court to grant it more time to complete consultations with states and union territories on the issue of granting minority status to Hindus in some states. Centre has termed the matter "sensitive", adding that it "will have far-reaching ramifications". The Hindu community comprises approximately 80% of the country's population, according to 2011 census data.

156.title: North Korea is covertly supplying artillery shells to Russia: US
156.article_body: US National Security Council spokesman John Kirby has said they've information that indicates North Korea is covertly supplying "significant" number of artillery shells to Russia for its Ukraine war. It was attempting to obscure the shipments by funneling them through Middle East and North Africa countries, he said. We'll consult with UN on accountability issues over the shipments, he added.

157.title: UK PM Sunak reverses decision to skip UN climate summit
157.article_body: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak on Wednesday said he will attend the upcoming United Nations (UN) climate summit in Egypt. Earlier, Sunak's office said the prime minister would skip COP27 as there were "pressing domestic commitments", which include preparations for the government's budget statement due on November 17. Sunak's decision to skip the meet was criticised.

158.title: Germany keeper Neuer reveals he was diagnosed with skin cancer, underwent 3 surgeries
158.article_body: Germany goalkeeper Manuel Neuer on Wednesday revealed that he was diagnosed with skin cancer. Neuer said that he has a scar near his nose, adding, "I had to be operated on three times and I had skin cancer there." Neuer, who won FIFA World Cup with Germany in 2014, didn't say when the operations took place.

159.title: Pic shows Twitter employee sleeping on the office floor after Musk's takeover
159.article_body: A Twitter employee shared a picture of Esther Crawford, Twitter's Director of Product Management, sleeping on the floor at Twitter's San Francisco headquarters. "When you need something from your boss at Elon Twitter," the employee captioned the picture, indicating it was taken after Elon Musk purchased Twitter. "Doing hard things requires sacrifice," Crawford tweeted in response to her picture.

160.title: India has role to play in political stability of B'desh: B'deshi minister
160.article_body: India's role in ensuring regional stability has helped Bangladesh maintain its political stability, Bangladesh Information Minister Hasan Mahmud said on Tuesday. Mahmud added that India has contributed to the progress of the country. "The relationship between India and Bangladesh is very diverse, it doesn't depend only on the Teesta water sharing. We are sharing many things," he further stated.

161.title: Sangrur sees 30% rise in patients with respiratory issues post Diwali
161.article_body: Punjab's Sangrur has witnessed around 30% rise in patients with respiratory issues, including cough, breathlessness, runny nose and itchiness in the eyes since Diwali. "Around 30 to 35 patients complaining about breathlessness, cough and other problems are visiting everyday," Dr Himanshu Garg, deployed at civil hospital, said. This year, Sangrur district is also worst hit due to stubble burning.

162.title: Akshay Kumar to play Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in Manjrekar's next
162.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar is set to play Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in filmmaker-actor Mahesh Manjrekar's directorial 'Veer Daudale Saat'. The film, which will be a pan-India Marathi film, is scheduled to release on Diwali 2023. Earlier this year, Akshay played the role of another historical figure Prithviraj Chauhan in the film 'Samrat Prithviraj'.

163.title: Haryana farmers facing shortage of DAP fertiliser: Bhupinder Hooda
163.article_body: Former Haryana CM and Congress leader Bhupinder Singh Hooda on Wednesday claimed that farmers in the state were facing shortage of diammonium phosphate fertiliser. "The situation is such that even after standing in queues for several days, farmers are not getting fertilisers for their crops," Hooda said. Criticising the government, he said Haryana has the highest unemployment rate of 31.8%.

164.title: Our aim is to keep 'Arjuna's eye' on inflation: RBI Governor Das
164.article_body: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das on Wednesday said the central bank wishes to concentrate on inflation in the same way as Arjuna focussed on hitting the eye of a revolving fish in the epic Mahabharata. "No one can match the prowess of Arjuna, but our constant endeavour is to keep an Arjuna's eye on inflation," Das said.

165.title: Model Heidi Klum dresses up as a worm for Halloween; pics go viral
165.article_body: Model Heidi Klum dressed up as a worm for her annual Halloween party and pictures of her look have gone viral. When asked about the outfit, Heidi said while laying down on the red carpet, "I don't know. I wanted to be something random. I wanted to think outside the box." "That's some commitment," a social media user commented.

166.title: Sikh soldier's statue unveiled in UK to honour those who fought in World Wars
166.article_body: A Sikh soldier's statue was unveiled in the UK on Sunday to honour contributions of the community, members of which fought in both World Wars for UK. The statue was reportedly made by artist Taranjit Singh. "We...honour the sacrifice of all those...who travelled [here] to fight for a country that wasn't their own," a Sikh group official said.

167.title: 2 women officers promoted as Inspector General for 1st time in CRPF
167.article_body: Two CRPF women officers have been promoted to the rank of Inspector General for the first time in the paramilitary force. IG Seema Dhundia will head the Bihar Sector of CRPF, while IG Annie Abraham will head Rapid Action Force (RAF), the CRPF said in a statement. This is the first time that RAF will be headed by a woman.

168.title: I wish the dating rumours about me were true: Siddhant Chaturvedi
168.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi, during an interview, was asked to share a rumour that he wishes were true. To this, he replied, "That I am dating, seeing someone. I wish that was true." This comes after there were rumours of Siddhant dating Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda. Siddhant will next feature in 'Phone Bhoot'.

169.title: 50-yr-old man killed as fire breaks out at paper godown in UP
169.article_body: A 50-year-old man, Lal Bahadur, was charred to death in a fire that broke out at a paper mill godown in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur in the early hours of Wednesday, police said. Bahadur, an employee, who was sleeping in the middle of paper bundles, got trapped inside and died. Property worth ₹2 crore was also destroyed, police added.

170.title: India test-fires Phase-II Ballistic Missile Defence interceptor
170.article_body: India on Wednesday conducted the successful maiden flight test of phase-II Ballistic Missile Defence (BMD) interceptor, AD-1 missile, from APJ Abdul Kalam Island in Odisha. The missile has a large kill altitude bracket. All BMD elements participated in the test. "AD-1 is a long-range interceptor missile designed for both low exo-atmospheric and endo-atmospheric interception," an official said.

171.title: SEBI's refunds to Sahara investors reach ₹138 crore since 2012
171.article_body: Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has processed ₹138 crore refunds to investors of two Sahara companies since 2012. The regulator added that the amount deposited in specially-opened bank accounts for the repayment has risen to over ₹24,000 crore. SEBI segregated ₹63,206 crore in dues pertaining to PACL Ltd and a Sahara Group company as "difficult to recover".

172.title: Never saw such huge influx of bodies: Crematoriums on Morbi tragedy
172.article_body: Crematoriums and graveyards in Gujarat's Morbi said they never saw a huge influx of bodies in such a short span of time in decades as they saw after the bridge collapse. At least 135 people were killed and several others were injured after the suspension bridge on Machchhu river collapsed on Sunday. Meanwhile, search for bodies continues at the site.

173.title: Congress synonymous with corruption, mafia: UP CM Yogi in Himachal
173.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM and BJP leader Yogi Adityanath criticised the Congress and said the party was synonymous with mafia and corruption. Addressing election rallies in Himachal Pradesh, he said it is the responsibility of people of Himachal Pradesh to keep these evils away.
