"The double engine government has given Himachal AIIMS, IIT, IIM, medical college...and free ration during...pandemic," he said.

174.title: Oil firms lose ₹4 per litre on diesel: Hardeep Puri on talks of price cut
174.article_body: Oil Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said PSU oil companies are losing a net ₹4 per litre on diesel, while speaking about talks of a price reduction. Puri said his ministry will seek assistance for three fuel retailers, IOC, BPCL and HPCL, for the losses they incurred on holding petrol and diesel prices since the Ukraine war to tackle inflation.

175.title: Kohli's Hindi-speaking Chinese fan cheers for him in Adelaide, says 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai'
175.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Virat Kohli and Team India's Hindi-speaking Chinese fan cheering for him in Adelaide. In the video, the fan can be heard saying, "Bharat Mata Ki Jai." The fan, who did not reveal his name, added that he learned Hindi because he loves Indian culture and is a language student at the Adelaide University.

176.title: BJP's Gautam Gambhir summoned over unauthorised construction on MCD dumping yard
176.article_body: A Delhi court has issued summon to BJP MP Gautam Gambhir over alleged unauthorised construction of a library on MCD land meant to be a dumping yard. The library has been constructed near Karkardooma court. As per summon, Gambhir must appear before the court on December 13. The petitioners are seeking an order to restrain Gambhir from using the library.

177.title: Never been abusive with Kejriwal: Delhi L-G office
177.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena has never been abusive in his communication with Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal, a statement from Raj Niwas stated on Wednesday. "On the contrary, even in matters of extreme breach of propriety or blatant verbal misconduct on part of the CM, his ministers and members of AAP, the L-G has...refrained from any comment," it added.

178.title: Rahul plays cricket with boy during Bharat Jodo Yatra, shares video
178.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday tweeted a video of him playing cricket with a boy on a road in Hyderabad during the Bharat Jodo Yatra. The boy was seen wearing a jersey of Team India. Rahul tweeted, "Donning the India jersey...makes you unbeatable. Well played #TeamIndia!" This comes after Team India defeated Bangladesh in the T20 World Cup 2022.

179.title: Teaser of 'Pathaan' copied from other films, claim Twitter users; share pics
179.article_body: After the teaser of 'Pathaan' was released, several Twitter users called out the makers for copying scenes from movies like 'WAR' and 'Captain America: The Winter Soldier'. They shared comparison pictures and pointed out resemblances. "Why [do]...action sequences in 'Pathaan' teaser keep reminding me of 'Winter Soldier'," a tweet read. Others also pointed out similarities with 'Dus' and 'Saaho'.

180.title: Encouraged to be recognized worldwide: Prateik on 'Four...' Emmy nomination
180.article_body: Actor Prateik Babbar, speaking about his show 'Four More Shots Please!' getting nominated at the International Emmy Award for Comedy in 2020, has said that it was extremely encouraging to be recognised worldwide. "There's a benchmark that has been set...we need to take it up a notch," the actor added. The show also featured Bani J and Kirti Kulhari.

181.title: Very little to do: Goa CBI on not having enough cases
181.article_body: The anti-corruption branch of Goa's Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) said that it has "very little to do" as there aren't enough cases. The superintendent of police heading the team of five officers said that the last bribery case they received was in 2018. SP (CBI) Ashesh Kumar said that over the last year, only three cases were registered.

182.title: Taking DNA of rape accused for probe not violation of his right: Kerala HC
182.article_body: The Kerala HC has said that a rape accused being asked to provide his DNA for criminal probe doesn't violate his constitutional right against self-incrimination. Justice Kauser Edappagath said the privilege of Article 20(3) is applicable only to testimonial evidence. The HC upheld a trial court's order urging a rape accused to provide his blood sample for a paternity test.

183.title: BYJU'S plans $1 billion IPO of subsidiary Aakash next fiscal: Report
183.article_body: BYJU'S is planning to list its subsidiary Aakash, an offline coaching chain, in the first half of next year, Moneycontrol reported. The size of the IPO could be in the range of $1 billion, valuing Aakash at $3.5-$4 billion. According to the report, BYJU'S plans to list by June 2024, or the first half of FY24.

184.title: SEBI categorises dues worth ₹67,228 crore as 'difficult to recover'
184.article_body: SEBI has segregated dues of ₹67,228 crore under "difficult to recover" category at the end of March 2022. Overall, SEBI has to recover ₹96,609 crore from entities including those that failed to pay the fine imposed on them, failed to pay fees due to markets watchdog and did not comply with its direction to refund investors' money.

185.title: Ranveer Singh invited to represent India at FIFA World Cup final: Report
185.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has reportedly been invited to represent India at the FIFA World Cup 2022 final in Qatar. A source told Bollywood Hungama, "Ranveer has become a cultural phenomenon globally. He represents the aspirational youth of India globally...is the perfect ambassador to be there at the FIFA World Cup final." The final will take place on December 18.

186.title: We don't want our partners to watch us die of cold live on TV: Ukraine
186.article_body: Senior Ukrainian adviser Mykhailo Podolyak has said western allies must speed up delivery of defensive weapons to protect energy infrastructure in the war-torn nation. "[They must] transfer as quickly as possible...defensive weapons so that Russia doesn't kill [Ukrainians] by freezing them to death," he said. "We don't want our partners to watch us dying from...cold live on TV," he added.

187.title: BYJU'S announces business expansion, to hire 600 in Kerala
187.article_body: BYJU'S has announced plans to expand business in Kerala and hire 600 people in the state following Founder Byju Raveendran's meeting with Chief Minister P Vijayan. The company said it will add three more offices in the state in this financial year, taking the total number to 14. The company also revoked its plan to shut down the Thiruvananthapuram office.

188.title: Voting in byelections to 7 assembly seats in 6 states on Thursday
188.article_body: Bypolls to seven seats in six states will be held on Thursday (November 3). The bypolls will be held in Munugode (Telangana), Andheri East (Maharashtra), Mokama (Bihar), Gopalganj (Bihar), Adampur (Haryana), Gola Gokrannath (Uttar Pradesh) and Dhamnagar (Odisha). The polls were necessitated due to the sitting legislator's death or resignation from elected party or due to a criminal conviction.

189.title: Elon Musk's net worth has fallen $9 billion since Twitter takeover
189.article_body: Billionaire Elon Musk's net worth has dropped about $9 billion since he took over Twitter on October 28, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Musk's net worth fell to $203 billion, down nearly 25% since the beginning of 2022. However, Musk is still the world's richest person, ahead of world's second richest person Bernard Arnault by around $65 billion.

190.title: Blue tick on Twitter is signifier of clout: CRED founder Kunal Shah
190.article_body: After Twitter's new owner Elon Musk announced $8/month price for blue tick, CRED Founder Kunal Shah called the tick a "signifier of clout" and said the decision would end in chaos. "Those with clout will lose their clout if they appear to be paying for this vanity badge...Those with no clout will buy...and try to appear important," Shah tweeted.

191.title: Look at rupee depreciation sans emotions: Shaktikanta Das
191.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das appealed to people to look at the depreciation of the rupee without any emotions and in the context of the current geopolitical crisis. He added that in comparison with other major currencies, the rupee has depreciated less. "The rupee has seen a very orderly movement since the onset of the current geopolitical crisis," Das added.

192.title: Google Chrome adds new sidebar for faster search results
192.article_body: Google has launched a new sidebar in Chrome that can make it faster and easier to check out search results without moving back and forth between multiple tabs. Users can click "Open search in side panel", which will display results in a side panel. The feature is reportedly similar to Microsoft Edge's sidebar.

193.title: Stalin like my brother, couldn't leave without meeting him: Mamata
193.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that Tamil Nadu counterpart MK Stalin is like her brother and she couldn't have left Chennai without meeting him. "I came to attend a family function but could not have left without meeting with Stalin...we did not discuss anything about politics," Mamata told ANI. The two leaders met at Stalin's residence.

194.title: Explore how specially-abled people can be in civil services: SC to Centre
194.article_body: The Supreme Court asked the Centre to explore how specially-abled people can be put under different categories in the civil services. A bench of Justices SA Nazeer and V Ramasubramanian said, "You please examine. They may not fit into all categories. Sympathy is one aspect, practicality is another aspect." Attorney General R Venkataramani sought time to look into the matter.

195.title: Poland to build temporary barrier along its border with Russia
195.article_body: Poland's Defence Minister Mariusz Blaszczak said the construction of a temporary barrier along the country's border with Russia will begin on Wednesday. The barrier, which will be 2.5 m high and 3 m deep, will be built along the Russian exclave of Kaliningrad, said Blaszczak. The barrier's construction will be completed by the end of 2023.

196.title: Yograj Singh joins Haasan's 'Indian 2', says 'Lion of Punjab is ready'
196.article_body: Former India cricketer Yograj Singh took to Instagram and announced that he will feature in Kamal Haasan's 'Indian 2'. He shared a picture of himself in the makeup room. Along with the picture, Yograj wrote, "Big respect to all heroes behind the camera...The Lion of Punjab is ready for 'Indian 2'...with Kamal Haasan ji (legend)."

197.title: Meghalaya CM Conrad K Sangma's chopper makes emergency landing
197.article_body: Meghalaya CM Conrad K Sangma's helicopter made an emergency landing near Shillong due to inclement weather on Wednesday, officials said. Sangma was flying from Tura to Shillong, an official said. "Emergency landing at UCC (Union Christian College) in Umiam...but enjoyed the view of the lovely campus during my walk...what a day!" Sangma tweeted.

198.title: Dy CM Fadnavis' wife urges Maha govt to not provide her traffic clearance vehicle
198.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis' wife Amruta Fadnavis on Wednesday requested Mumbai Police to not provide her a traffic clearance pilot vehicle. It was provided to her as part of her security upgrade cleared by the state's Home Department, headed by Devendra Fadnavis. "I am and wish to live like a common citizen of Mumbai," she said.

199.title: How can Pakistan still qualify for T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals?
199.article_body: Pakistan are currently placed fifth on T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 Group 2 points table. To advance, Pakistan would need to beat South Africa and Bangladesh, and would need India or South Africa to lose their final Super 12 match. In case South Africa and India win, Pakistan would be knocked out even if they win their remaining matches.

200.title: Which multiple T20 World Cup records does Virat Kohli hold?
200.article_body: Virat Kohli today broke the record for scoring most runs (1,065) in T20 World Cup history. Kohli also holds the record for the highest batting average (88.75) in T20 World Cup history. Further, he has hit most fifties (13) in T20 World Cups. Kohli also has the most Player of the Match awards (seven) in the tournament history.

201.title: Let 'KGF' be our mantra: Piyush Goyal as he invites people to invest in Karnataka
201.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal, while speaking at the Invest Karnataka summit, invited people to invest in Karnataka by saying, "Let KGF be our mantra - Karnataka Growth & Future." Goyal said, "Wherever I go, there's great excitement about Karnataka." He added, "There's a large amount of investor interest leading to the investment potential of at least ₹7 lakh crore."

202.title: Was told 'Industry will not get you back if you take break': Sarika
202.article_body: Actress Sarika said that her friends panicked when she decided to take a break from her acting career for a year. "My friends...told me, 'Don't be stupid! This industry...will not get you back'," she added. "I was like...if I am offered an old woman's role, I would happily take that up as well. I just wanted to act," she stated.

203.title: Saddened by death of Ela Bhatt, she'll long be remembered: PM Modi
203.article_body: PM Narendra Modi condoled the death of 89-year-old women's rights activist Ela Bhatt who passed away on Wednesday. The PM tweeted, "Saddened by the death of Elaben Bhatt. She will long be remembered for her efforts to promote women's empowerment, social service, and education among the youth...Om Shanti." Congress MP Rahul Gandhi said, "She devoted her life to Gandhian ideals."

204.title: Jairam Thakur is HP's accidental CM, even Biden can't save him: Oppn leader
204.article_body: Ahead of the Assembly polls in Himachal Pradesh, Leader of Opposition Mukesh Agnihotri called CM Jairam Thakur an "accidental CM". Agnihotri stated that Thakur's government has been a non-performing one, further claiming that the latter is dependent on PM Narendra Modi's support for survival. "No one can save [Thakur] now, not even [US President] Joe Biden," Agnihotri said.

205.title: We see no signs that Russia is preparing to use nuclear weapons: US
205.article_body: White House spokesman John Kirby has said the US doesn't see any signs that Russia is making preparations to use nuclear weapons in Ukraine. Kirby said, "We've been clear...that Russia's comments about the potential use of nuclear weapons are deeply concerning." "We...monitor this as best we can and...see no indications that Russia is making preparations for such use," he added.

206.title: Craze for glimpse of SRK's 'Pathaan' has been unprecedented: Director
206.article_body: Director Siddharth Anand has said that there was no better day to release the teaser of 'Pathaan' than Shah Rukh Khan's birthday. "The craze for a glimpse of 'Pathaan' has been unprecedented. After a long, long time there's [an] insane buzz for a film that's genuine and organic...it's all due to the super stardom of...Shah Rukh," he added.

207.title: Amazon's m-cap falls below $1-trillion mark for first time since April 2020
207.article_body: Shares of e-commerce firm Amazon fell on Tuesday, taking the firm's market capitalisation (m-cap) below the $1-trillion mark for the first time since April 2020. Amazon's stock fell 5.5% to close at $96.79 at an m-cap of $987.4 billion. This comes after Amazon reported its earnings last week, when it projected the slowest July-September quarter growth in its history.

208.title: UK sanctions 4 Russian steel, petrochemical tycoons funding Putin's war
208.article_body: UK has sanctioned four Russian steel and petrochemical business owners "who rely on Russian President Vladimir Putin for their positions of authority and fund his military machine", Foreign Secretary James Cleverly said. "[We're] ramping up the economic pressure on Putin and will...do so until Ukraine prevails," he said. Those sanctioned include Alexander Frolov, ex-CEO of steel producer Evraz.

209.title: Video shows EVM, chairs being thrown as men clash during Haryana panchayat polls
209.article_body: Clashes broke out between two groups during polling for the panchayat election in Zahidpur village of Haryana's Jhajjar district on Wednesday. A video has surfaced showing some people throwing chairs at each other. They were also seen throwing an electronic voting machine (EVM) and election materials. An EVM was damaged in the incident.

210.title: 153 commercial premises in Thane fined for lacking Marathi signboards
210.article_body: As many as 153 shops and commercial establishments in Maharashtra's Thane district have been fined for not displaying signboards in the Marathi language. Thane Deputy Labour Commissioner Santosh Bhosale said 15 of the 153 establishments were fined ₹3.49 lakh. As per the state government's directives, all commercial establishments and shops are expected to display signboards in Marathi.

211.title: Can tackle attrition by seeking new talent sources: Rishad Premji
211.article_body: Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji said the IT sector faces high level of attrition because companies chase the same talent pool. In order to widen the talent pool, he said that new locations and sources must be sought and flexibility of remote work should be provided. He added that to tackle attrition they should also reskill existing pool with new-age technologies.

212.title: 2 men stripped, paraded and whipped for selling beef in Chhattisgarh; video surfaces
212.article_body: Two men were stripped, paraded and whipped with a belt for allegedly selling beef in Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur district. The two men have been arrested and police said over 33 kg of beef was recovered from them. There is also no information on whether any action has been taken against the men involved in whipping them.

213.title: IIT alumni founded AlmaBetter raises $2.7 mn from Kalaari Capital, others
213.article_body: Upskilling startup AlmaBetter raised $2.7 million in a seed round led by Kalaari Capital. The round also saw participation from investors such as Vidit Aatrey (CEO, Meesho), Sanjeev Barnwal (CTO, Meesho) and Varun Alagh (CEO, MamaEarth), among others. AlmaBetter was founded by IIT Delhi and Kharagpur alumni Shivam Dutta, Vikash Srivastava, Ravi Kumar Gupta, Arshyan Ahsan and Alok Anand.

214.title: 16-yr-old electrocuted to death at coaching centre in Odisha's Kendrapara
214.article_body: A 16-year-old student, Debi Prasad Dash, was electrocuted to death after coming in contact with a high-tension wire at a residential coaching centre in Odisha's Kendrapara, police said on Wednesday. Dash, a resident of Gopinath village, accidentally came in contact with an 11 KV line. The deceased's family members have filed an FIR against the coaching centre authorities alleging negligence.

215.title: Congress' promise to restore old pension scheme is a bait: Himachal CM
215.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur criticised Congress over its promise to restore the old pension scheme, calling it a bait and said the scheme was ended during Congress leader Virbhadra Singh's government. "Now their eyes are on the vote...they feel that something can be done by giving inducements," Thakur said, questioning why the scheme wasn't restarted between 2013 and 2017.

216.title: Hackers send fake mails to exploit Musk's plan to charge for blue tick
216.article_body: Hackers are sending phishing emails to lure Twitter users for a blue tick in an attempt to get their account credentials, according to a report. The phishing attacks began after Twitter's new owner Elon Musk announced an $8 monthly fee for a blue tick in subscribers' accounts. The emails have "don’t lose your free verified status" in the subject line.

217.title: Unverified screenshot on Covid curb easing causes $450 bn stock rally in China
217.article_body: An unverified screenshot of four paragraphs detailing China's reopening plan following the lawmakers' meeting with COVID-19 experts went viral in China, causing a $450-billion rally in stocks. The screenshot, with no identifying marks, began circulating on Monday night in WeChat groups filled with analysts and fund managers. Prominent economists and financial platforms also shared the screenshot.

218.title: Lotus Herbals acquires 20% stake in startup Yogic Secrets
218.article_body: Lotus Herbals said that it has acquired a 20% stake in direct-to-consumer nutraceuticals and health supplement startup Yogic Secrets Healthcare for an undisclosed amount. According to a joint statement, Yogic Secrets will use the funds to scale up its operations in India and also expand globally. This is Lotus' fifth investment in emerging brands in the beauty and wellness space.

219.title: Pregnancy may change woman’s bones forever: Study
219.article_body: A study has found that pregnancy can permanently change the makeup of a woman’s bones. Anthropologists have discovered that female primates who had babies show reduced levels of calcium and phosphorus as compared to those who have not reproduced. A significant drop in magnesium levels as a result of breastfeeding was also noticed in their bones.

220.title: Google to discontinue its dedicated Street View app in 2023: Report
220.article_body: Google has announced plans to discontinue its dedicated Street View app on Android next year. According to a report by 9to5Google, the company has prepared a notice to advice users to shift to Google Maps or Street View Studio. The app, launched in July in India, allows users to explore an area through 360-degree panoramic street-level images.

221.title: Another Maharashtra transport bus catches fire; all 43 passengers safe
221.article_body: A Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) bus carrying 43 passengers caught fire in Maharashtra's Nashik on Wednesday. The bus driver immediately stopped the bus on the side of the Sinnar-Nashik-Pune road and pulled out all the passengers. A similar incident took place in Pune on Tuesday.

222.title: MP official, yet to receive govt bungalow, living in tent for 3 months
222.article_body: The panchayat chief of a Madhya Pradesh district has been living in a tent for the past three months as he is yet to get a government bungalow. Rudesh Paraste from Dindori district told ANI that he's attending to the residents' problems while living in the tent. "We're facing many issues but will manage to serve the public," he said.

223.title: Independent India's first voter, aged 106, casts vote in Himachal
223.article_body: Shyam Saran Negi, the first voter of independent India, cast his vote for the 34th time by voting for Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections through a postal ballot on Wednesday. This is the first time the 106-year-old cast his vote at his residence. Kinnaur Deputy Commissioner Abid Hussain Sadiq greeted the retired school teacher with a Kinnauri cap and a muffler.

224.title: Media had painted me as bold, always got negative roles: Neena Gupta
224.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta said she always got negative roles after the media had "painted" her as bold. "Fighting this tag was very frustrating for many years. It truly was. It was important back then to get typecast," she added. Neena said that she suffered as she never followed the "trend". "Not anymore, now I'm happy, satisfied and thankful," she stated.

225.title: Cobra dies after being bitten by 8-year-old boy in Chhattisgarh
225.article_body: A cobra reportedly died after it was bitten by an eight-year-old boy in Pandrapath village of Chhattisgarh. The snake got wrapped around the boy's hand and bit him. As the reptile didn't budge after he tried to shake it off, he bit it, following which it died. The boy was administered anti-snake venom doses and discharged from the hospital.

226.title: India to have above-normal minimum temperature in November: IMD
226.article_body: The minimum temperatures are expected to be above normal during November over most parts of the country, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. Jammu and Kashmir, Ladakh, Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand are also likely to experience above-normal day temperatures. IMD Director General Mrutyunjay Mohapatra said there could be cloudy conditions in the region.

227.title: Only those from political families considered for CM’s post in Congress: Shah
227.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah held several election rallies across Himachal Pradesh and accused Congress of luring politicians by promising to make them the Chief Minister. "This is only a ploy to win some seats," Shah said. "In the Congress, it's mandatory that one is from a political family for being considered for the post of Chief Minister," he added.

228.title: PM should be summoned in many cases: JMM leader on ED summons to Hemant Soren
228.article_body: After the Enforcement Directorate (ED) summoned Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren in a money laundering probe linked to an alleged illegal mining case, JMM leader Manoj Pandey accused the Centre of vendetta politics. "PM should also be summoned in several cases," Pandey said. "We'll approach the court if there's injustice. Don't know if the ED can summon a CM," he added.

229.title: Formula E race track in Hyderabad to be ready by end of November
229.article_body: Ahead of the Formula E race in Hyderabad next year, Urban Development Special Chief Secretary Arvind Kumar inspected the ongoing works undertaken by the Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA). "The track will be ready by the end of November," Kumar tweeted. The first-ever Formula E race in India is scheduled to be held in Hyderabad on February 11, 2023.

230.title: More people are going to get hurt if US political climate persists: Obama
230.article_body: Former US President Barack Obama on Wednesday said that "more people are going to get hurt" unless the US political climate changes. Obama's comments came after a man attacked the husband of the Speaker of the House, Nancy Pelosi, fracturing his skull and causing other injuries. "This increasing habit of demonizing political opponents creates a dangerous climate," Obama added.

231.title: Vinod Kapri shares video comparing air quality, visibility in Delhi and Mumbai
231.article_body: Filmmaker Vinod Kapri tweeted a video comparing the air quality and visibility in Delhi and Mumbai on Wednesday. "This was taken at 9:40 am in Delhi and 11:33 am in Mumbai," he tweeted. Tagging Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, he asked, "Is it the Congress government in Punjab or the Modi government at the Centre who's responsible for Delhi's horrific pictures?"

232.title: How does the points table read after India's 3rd win in T20 World Cup 2022?
232.article_body: After bagging their third victory in T20 World Cup 2022, India jumped to the top position on the Super 12 stage Group 2 points table. India have accumulated six points. South Africa follow India with five points, while Bangladesh are third with four points. Bangladesh are followed by Zimbabwe (three points), Pakistan (two points) and Netherlands (two points).

233.title: Arunachal will be favourite film shooting destination after 'Bhediya': CM
233.article_body: Arunachal Pradesh Chief Minister Pema Khandu took to Twitter and thanked 'Bhediya' director Amar Kaushik and producer Dinesh Vijan after the film was entirely shot in the state. "I'm sure Arunachal is going to be a favourite film shooting destination...The film will give a new identity to the people of North East," he tweeted. 'Bhediya' features Varun Dhawan.

234.title: Indian economy an island of calm amid global challenges: Sitharaman
234.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the Indian economy is an island of relative calm in a challenging global environment. Sitharaman added that while India had its share of challenges, they weren't large enough to threaten the country. "Honourable Prime Minister...made sure the Indian economy will not be severely threatened by the developments outside," Sitharaman said.

235.title: SRK fans parade outside Mannat, sing 'Baadshah O Baadshah'; video surfaces
235.article_body: Several fans of Shah Rukh Khan marched outside his bungalow, Mannat, in Mumbai on Wednesday afternoon. A video that surfaced online showed fans holding placards and banners featuring the actor. While some fans can be seen chanting "We love Shah Rukh" in the video, another group is seen singing "Baadshah O Baadshah" to celebrate the actor's 57th birthday.

236.title: Adani Group to invest ₹1 lakh crore in Karnataka in 7 years: Karan Adani
236.article_body: Karan Gautam Adani said Adani Group has plans to invest almost ₹1 lakh crore over the next seven years in Karnataka in an attempt to expand its footprint in multiple sectors. He said, "We are seeking to capitalise on unmatched strength the state offers in the tech space." "Adani Group will expand the Mangaluru airport as well," Adani shared.

237.title: Indian envoy to US asks TAC Security CEO to aid Indian startups
237.article_body: Indian Ambassador to the US, Taranjit Singh Sandhu, met CEO of cybersecurity firm TAC Security, Trishneet Arora and asked him to help out startups in India, including Punjab. According to a tweet posted by Sandhu, the two discussed cyber threats, technology and knowledge partnership and the importance of mentorship and skill development. Trishneet, the 28-year-old founder, was born in Ludhiana.

238.title: Violence erupts as rival groups hurl stones amid Haryana panchayat polls
238.article_body: Violence broke out between two rival groups in Haryana's Nuh district on Wednesday morning during panchayat elections in Chandaka village. The groups also hurled stones at each other. Varun Singla, Nuh's Superintendent of Police, said, "A home guard was injured after a stone hit his chest." As per reports, several police personnel were injured during the altercation.

239.title: Hindi version of 'Kantara' beats lifetime collection of 'KGF 1'
239.article_body: The Hindi version of 'Kantara' has surpassed the lifetime collection of Yash's Hindi-dubbed 'KGF: Chapter 1', as per trade analyst Taran Adarsh. "Week three will be higher than week one and week two. [The film] will cross ₹50 crore mark in week three. THIS FILM IS TRULY UNSTOPPABLE," Taran tweeted. The film is directed and written by Rishab Shetty.

240.title: Microsoft Prez Smith warns of talent shortage to combat climate change
240.article_body: Microsoft President Brad Smith said thousands of companies will fail to meet pledges to combat climate change unless they start training employees on sustainability. "Companies should...pay for continuing education and convene on carbon-reduction strategies," Smith said. Microsoft has grown its sustainability headcount to about 250 employees from only 30 in last three years, he added.

241.title: We urge all to keep calm: Russia as N Korea fired over 20 missiles
241.article_body: After North Korea fired over 20 missiles into the water on Wednesday, Russia called for calm. "We urge everyone to keep calm...All parties to this conflict should avoid taking any steps that could provoke a further increase in tensions," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. Reportedly, one of the missiles fired by North Korea landed close to South Korea's territorial waters.

242.title: 10.5 km walk to be precise: Pooja Bhatt on tweet calling walk with Rahul Gandhi 'brief'
242.article_body: Pooja Bhatt has reacted to a tweet by a media house that read, "Actress-filmmaker Pooja Bhatt briefly joins the Congress party's Bharat Jodo Yatra. The Yatra resumed from Hyderabad city in Telangana this morning." "Yes a 'brief' 10.5 km walk to be precise," she responded. The Bharat Jodo Yatra commenced on September 7 from Kanyakumari in Tamil Nadu.

243.title: L-G launches 'Operation Clean Delhi' ahead of India's G-20 presidency
243.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena has launched sanitation drive 'Operation Clean Delhi' from the city's Mayapuri area. The focus of the initiative will be to ensure cleanliness and beautification so that guests to G-20 meetings carry back a "good impression" of Delhi. India is set to assume the presidency of the G-20 for one year from December 1, 2022.

244.title: Why no CBI, ED action over Morbi bridge collapse?: Mamata Banerjee
244.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee questioned why there was no action by central agencies, such as the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) and the Enforcement Directorate (ED), in the Morbi Bridge collapse incident. Alleging that the agencies only act against common people, she further questioned, "Why are they not investigating people who are playing with the lives of others?"

245.title: When I became assistant director, I chased films SRK was part of: Ayan
245.article_body: On the occasion of actor Shah Rukh Khan's birthday, 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji revealed he chased films that Shah Rukh was part of, after he became an assistant director. "I'm a huge Shah Rukh Khan fan and have been touched by his, like magnetism in a very deep way," he added. Shah Rukh had a cameo in Ayan's 'Brahmastra'.

246.title: It's our responsibility to protect party that protected you: BJP's Nadda
246.article_body: Speaking at a public rally in Himachal Pradesh's Bilaspur, BJP National President JP Nadda said, "PM Narendra Modi ji made two vaccines on our land within nine months, inoculated all of you with double dose and booster dose and shielded you." "Now is the time to protect. It is our responsibility to protect the party who protected you," he added.

247.title: Planning to set up new prison, 7 more police stations in Mumbai: Fadnavis
247.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said that the state government is planning to set up a new prison and seven new police stations in Mumbai. Currently, there is only one Arthur Road Jail in Mumbai. "Discussion on requirement of new jail in Mumbai, Nagpur, Pune also took place," Fadnavis tweeted after a meeting with the police officials on Tuesday.

248.title: Video shows Bengaluru's new e-buses getting charged
248.article_body: A video of new state-run electric buses getting charged in Bengaluru is being widely shared online. A transport corporation official is seen charging the buses at Yelahanka Bus Station. The electric buses are charged daily at Majestic, Puttenahalli and Yelahanka bus stations. The buses are charged for about 1 hour which powers them to run for 200 km.

249.title: AirAsia sells remaining 16.33% stake in AirAsia India to Air India
249.article_body: AirAsia Aviation Group (AAAGL), holding company of Capital A's airline group, announced that it has sold its remaining stake in its India operations to Air India. The company said AAAGL is expected to receive ₹155.6 crore in gross proceeds. The company added that Capital A has marked the remaining 16.33% in AirAsia (India) (AAI) to its fair value.

250.title: Shah Rukh Khan shares his selfie with a sea of fans on his 57th birthday
250.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan took to Twitter to share his selfie that showed a sea of his fans in the background that had gathered outside his house in Mumbai to wish him on his 57th birthday. "It's so lovely to live in front of the sea...the sea of love that spreads all around me on my birthday," the actor tweeted.

251.title: K'taka govt inks ₹5.20 lakh crore deals in B'luru investors meet
251.article_body: The Karnataka government inked investment agreements worth ₹5.20 lakh crore on Wednesday, on the first day of the three-day Invest Karnataka 2022 - Global Investors Meet, which is being held in Bengaluru. The 'Manufacturing-Green Hydrogen and Derivatives' sector received the most investments as seven companies signed Memorandums of Understanding worth ₹2.9 lakh crore in the sector.

252.title: Driver abducts 2-year-old girl, rapes her inside truck’s cabin in Gujarat
252.article_body: A 25-year-old truck driver was arrested for allegedly abducting a 2-year-old girl from a road in Gujarat's Surat and raping her inside the truck's cabin during the early hours of Tuesday. Police caught the accused red-handed around six kilometres away from the spot from where she was kidnapped. The girl has been hospitalised with severe injuries to her private parts.

253.title: India defeat Bangladesh in rain-curtailed match, go top of T20 WC 2022 points table
253.article_body: India defeated Bangladesh by five runs (DLS method) in a rain-curtailed T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage Group 2 match on Wednesday. With the victory, India went top of Group 2 points table with six points. Bangladesh were given a revised target of 151 runs from 16 overs after rain interruption. India restricted them to 145/6 in 16 overs.

254.title: PM Modi inaugurates over 3,000 flats built for slum dwellers in Delhi
254.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has inaugurated 3,024 newly constructed flats to house slum dwellers in Delhi. The flats, which have been built at a cost of ₹345 crore, are located in south Delhi's Kalkaji area. "Today is a big day for thousands of slum dwellers; a new beginning to life," PM Modi said at the function to mark the occasion today.

255.title: 2 killed, 2 injured as car falls into roadside gorge in Raj's Baran
255.article_body: Two people died and two others were injured when their car fell into a deep gorge in Rajasthan's Baran, police said on Wednesday. The incident took place when the four persons were returning home after attending a wedding in Madhya Pradesh's Guna, Bapcha SHO Surendra Kuntal said. The police patrolling vehicle rushed them to a community health centre at Bapcha.

256.title: Foreign investors, MFs increase stake in Paytm for second straight quarter
256.article_body: Paytm, in its latest shareholding pattern filing, said foreign institutional investors (FIIs) and mutual funds increased stakes in its parent One97 Communications for the second consecutive quarter in the July-September period. Stake of foreign investors increased from 5.14% to 5.77% in the quarter. Mutual funds also increased their stake to 1.26% in the September quarter from 1.14% a quarter ago.

257.title: Padma Bhushan recipient and women's rights activist Ela Bhatt passes away aged 89
257.article_body: Noted women's rights activist, lawyer and Padma Bhushan recipient Ela Bhatt passed away on Wednesday at the age of 89. She founded and headed the Self-Employed Women's Association (SEWA) in India. She also set up a cooperative bank in 1974 to provide small loans to women and co-founded Women's World Banking (WWB), a global network of micro-finance organisations.

258.title: Woman, child flung into air as car rams into bike in Pune, video surfaces
258.article_body: A woman and her child were flung into the air when a car rammed into the motorcycle they were riding on in Pune. The accident took place when the two vehicles were taking a turn. A CCTV footage of the incident has surfaced online, showing the duo getting thrown in the air as the car rams the motorcycle's rear part.

259.title: TN ministers, officials hold high-level meeting amid heavy rainfall
259.article_body: Several Tamil Nadu ministers, Chennai Mayor R Priya, Greater Chennai Corporation Commissioner Gagandeep Singh Bedi and other officials held a high-level meeting in Chennai to take stock of the situation amid heavy rainfall. Minister KN Nehru said 205.47 mm of rainfall was recorded in Chennai between October 31 and November 2. Waterlogging was reported in only three subways, he added.

260.title: IFS officer shares pic of snake, says 'Let's see who can guess the species'
260.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan tweeted a picture of a snake. "This beauty. Let's see who can guess the species," he wrote. "King Cobra; Ophiophagus hannah. 'Ophiophagus' is derived from Greek, meaning 'snake-eating' and hannah is derived from the name of tree-dwelling nymphs in Greek mythology," he later added. "The snake whose 100% diet is other big snakes," his tweet read.

261.title: Govt planning PLI 2.0 for textiles to compete with Vietnam, China: Goyal
261.article_body: Textile Minister Piyush Goyal said the government is considering the second phase of the Production Linked Incentive scheme for the textile industry to help the industry compete with top markets like Vietnam and China. He said industry officials have been asked to undertake extensive stakeholder consultations. Goyal emphasised that the textile sector's USP should not be restricted to cheap labour.

262.title: Pune woman reports husband missing, arrested months later for his murder
262.article_body: A woman from Pune's Baramati, who approached the police in February stating that her husband had gone missing, was arrested months later for his murder. Police have also arrested the woman's lover and his two friends. The woman, along with her lover and his friends, had allegedly beaten the man to death and dumped his body in a water stream.

263.title: Maruti Suzuki crosses 2.5 crore production mark in India
263.article_body: Maruti Suzuki on Wednesday said it has crossed 2.5 crore cumulative production mark since starting operations in India in 1983. "2022 marks 40 years of Suzuki's partnership with the people of India," said CEO Hisashi Takeuchi. The company has become the only Indian original equipment manufacturer (OEM) to have achieved this feat in passenger vehicle production.

264.title: Inspect repair work done by BBMP: K'taka HC to NHAI amid pothole deaths
264.article_body: The Karnataka HC has ordered the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) to inspect repair work done on potholes in Bengaluru. The court also criticised the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) for the number of fatalities caused by potholes. A 22-year-old biker died after being hit by a car that overturned due to a pothole in the city last month.

265.title: Carcasses of 3 cows found in Mumbai forest, case filed
265.article_body: Carcasses of three cows were found in a forest in Mumbai, police said on Wednesday. Police took the carcasses in their possession to send them for post-mortem. A case has been filed against unidentified people under Section 429 of the Indian Penal Code (IPC). The incident was reported near Aarey Milk Colony Unit 17 in Goregaon area.

266.title: Govt raises cost of ethanol for blending in petrol by ₹2.15
266.article_body: The Union Cabinet raised the cost of ethanol procured by public sector oil marketing companies (OMCs) for blending into petrol by ₹2.15. The cost has been raised to ₹65.6 per litre from ₹63.45 per litre. Price of ethanol from C heavy molasses was increased to ₹49.41 per litre while ethanol derived from B heavy molasses will cost ₹60.73 per litre.

267.title: Still not convinced with his approach: Ganesh on KL Rahul's 50(32)
267.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Dodda Ganesh took to Twitter to share his opinion on KL Rahul's 50(32) in India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Bangladesh, stating that he's still "not convinced" by Rahul's approach in the powerplay. "You can't play the waiting game in the powerplay," added Ganesh in his tweet. Rahul had a strike rate of 156.25.

268.title: That's his opinion: Akram on Gambhir criticising Babar's captaincy
268.article_body: Sharing his opinion on Gautam Gambhir criticising Babar Azam's captaincy, ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram said, "That is his opinion...Everybody, I suppose, has a right to give their opinion." Talking about Babar's captaincy during Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Netherlands, Gautam Gambhir had said, "[He] should have sent Fakhar Zaman up the...order. This is called selfishness."

269.title: Accountability should be fixed: Mamata on Morbi bridge collapse
269.article_body: Following the Morbi bridge collapse incident in Gujarat, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said that the accountability should be fixed. "I'll not talk anything about politics...People's lives are important than politics. I express my condolences," she added. "A judicial commission should be made under the Supreme Court to probe the Morbi incident," Banerjee stated.

270.title: Ukrainian man plotting to sabotage Crimea power line detained: Russia
270.article_body: Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) has said that a Ukrainian citizen has been detained over suspicion of planning to "sabotage" a power line in Crimea. The man, in his 40s, had been found carrying diagrams of power lines, three explosive devices and instructions on how to use them. The FSB suspected that the man had been recruited by Ukrainian intelligence.

271.title: K’taka believes in converting calamity into opportunity: CM Bommai
271.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday said that his government believes in converting calamity into an opportunity. "We've to believe in ourselves...believe in our capabilities and abilities during the tough times," Bommai added while speaking at the Global Investors Meet 2022. "Karnataka is not only a place with a better ecosystem but we are a forward-looking policy state," he stated.

272.title: Man keeps ₹250 cr lottery win in China a secret from family fearing they'll get lazy
272.article_body: A man in China is keeping his 219 million yuan (around ₹250 crore) lottery jackpot a secret from his family. "I didn't tell my wife and child, for fear that they would be too complacent and wouldn't work or work hard in the future," he said. He collected the prize money alone in a costume that kept his identity hidden.

273.title: Virat Kohli's reaction to KL Rahul's 96-metre six against Bangladesh goes viral
273.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing Virat Kohli's reaction to KL Rahul's 96-metre six on the bowling of Bangladesh's Shoriful Islam in India's ninth over in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Wednesday. In the video, Kohli can be seen following the trajectory of the ball while appearing shocked. Rahul scored 50(32) in the innings.

274.title: The ones calling it boring are jealous: Shekhar on 'Bigg Boss 16' segment
274.article_body: Actor Shekhar Suman said that those calling his 'Bigg Boss 16' segment "boring" are either "jealous people" or "bought bots". "It could be the work of rival channels, competitors or even people who don't like the fact that I am back," he added. Shekhar Suman is seen hosting the 'Bigg Bulletin' segment on the reality show's Sunday episode.

275.title: Driver of Kerala minister’s staff arrested for assaulting woman
275.article_body: A contract driver of Kerala Water Resources Minister Roshy Augustine's private secretary was arrested for allegedly assaulting a woman when she was out for a morning walk near Thiruvananthapuram's Museum area, police said. The driver has also been arrested for trespassing into a house recently, an officer of Museum police station said.

276.title: MU to give new marksheets to more than 3,000 law students over PRN error
276.article_body: The Mumbai University (MU) will give new marksheets to over 3,000 final-year law students after it was found that Permanent Registration Number (PRN) on them was erroneous, an official said. The content in the marksheets is correct, except for the 16-digit PRN, a unique reference number throughout the course, the official added. The error was detected in 3,064 marksheets.

277.title: Delhi govt appeals to people to work from home amid worsening air quality
277.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Wednesday appealed to people to work from home amid worsening air quality in the national capital. Rai further appealed to people to adopt the practice of carpooling and avoid taking out private vehicles, saying, "50% of the pollution is from vehicles." Notably, Delhi's overall air quality on Wednesday morning was recorded as 'very poor'.

278.title: Kyiv shoots down 12 of 13 'kamikaze' drones in latest attack: Ukraine
278.article_body: Kyiv was targeted in more drone attacks overnight, head of the Ukrainian President's office said. Andriy Yermak said 12 out of 13 drones launched towards Kyiv were shot down, adding that Iranian-made "kamikaze" drones were used again. Ukraine maintains that the drones have been used to attack the country's infrastructure. Russia earlier denied using "kamikaze" drones in Ukraine.

279.title: BYJU'S cancels 140 layoffs in Kerala after Founder Raveendran meets CM
279.article_body: Edtech startup BYJU'S has decided to continue its office operations in Kerala's Trivandrum, revoking the layoff of 140 employees who operate from that centre. The development came after a detailed discussion between Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan and the startup's Founder Byju Raveendran. A week back, BYJU'S was planning to shut down the Kerala office.

280.title: SRK watched 'Don' & partied with us in Australia: Vidya Malavade
280.article_body: Actress Vidya Malavade recalled that during the Australia schedule of 'Chak De! India', Shah Rukh Khan took the whole team out to watch his film 'Don'. "I actually watched the film sitting next to him," she shared, adding that he also took all of them out to party. She remembered that they called him 'papa' when he was not around.

281.title: Puneeth Rajkumar got excited about 'Kantara', he later refused: Rishab
281.article_body: Rishab Shetty, who played the lead and directed 'Kantara', revealed he offered the film to late actor Puneeth Rajkumar. "Soon after I narrated the story to him, he got very excited about the project. He wanted to explore different stories," he added. "One day, he called me and asked me to go ahead with the film without him," Rishab stated.

282.title: Brilliant, Indian batting looks more formidable: Irfan on Rahul's 50(32)
282.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan took to Twitter to term KL Rahul's 50 off 32 balls in India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Bangladesh as "brilliant", adding that the Indian batting looks "more formidable". "We should stop...overhyping on [the basis of] one innings...and take...notice of how it's been over a period of time," read a reaction to his tweet.

283.title: Pollution issue isn’t state’s problem, it happens due to air system: Gopal Rai
283.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Wednesday requested the UP and Haryana governments to form a regional special task force to reduce air pollution in areas adjoining Delhi like Gurugram, Faridabad, Ghaziabad and Noida. "The pollution problem is not the state's problem. It happens due to the air system that develops," Rai said.

284.title: Couple pays contract killers ₹8 lakh to get alcoholic son killed in T'gana
284.article_body: A couple in Telangana's Khammam district reportedly hired contract killers for ₹8 lakh to get their only son killed. They were allegedly fed up with him as he was an alcoholic and used to beat them. The 26-year-old man was strangled to death and his body was found dumped in Suryapet. Police have arrested the couple.

285.title: IT professional robbed, assaulted by fake policemen on Pune road
285.article_body: Three people posing as policemen robbed an IT engineer on Pimpalgaon road in Pune district after stopping his car and accusing him of violating traffic rules on Monday. The accused made the victim sit in their car on the pretext of taking him to police station. They robbed his phone and assaulted him with an iron rod when he resisted.

286.title: Sun Pharma's m-cap crosses ₹2.5 lakh crore after 7 years
286.article_body: The market capitalisation of Sun Pharmaceutical Industries crossed ₹2.5 lakh crore for the first time in more than seven years as its shares gained the most among its Nifty 50 peers on Wednesday. Its stock surged by 1.81% to ₹1,051.75/piece on BSE. On Tuesday, Sun Pharmaceutical reported a 10.5% year-over-year rise in its consolidated net profit in the July-September quarter.

287.title: Vanished from industry when I was still a top contender: Anu Aggarwal
287.article_body: Anu Aggarwal of 'Aashiqui' fame expressed that she was facing "the dark night of the soul" when she was at the peak of success in her acting career. "Ironically, when the world thought I had everything, I was the unhappiest ever," she said. Anu added that she "vanished" from the film industry when she was "a top contender".

288.title: T'gana Guv launches first aid master training programme in Hyderabad
288.article_body: Telangana Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan on Tuesday inaugurated the first aid master trainers' training programme in Hyderabad's Raj Bhavan. Around 20 health practitioners from states including Telangana, Odisha, Tamil Nadu and Andhra Pradesh will be trained to be ready to respond during emergencies. "Appealed all to be aware of first aid, that plays vital role in saving lives," she tweeted.

289.title: Delhi to get special mohalla clinics for women, will provide free services
289.article_body: Delhi will now have special mohalla clinics for women where gynaecological services, tests and medicines will be made available to beneficiaries free of charge. "Another new initiative is going to happen in the national capital's world-class health services from today," Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal wrote on Twitter. The mohalla clinic system is a flagship healthcare scheme of the Kejriwal government.

290.title: Pune civic body staffer finds 11 live cartridges, weapons in bag
290.article_body: A 42-year-old Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) cleaning staffer found 11 live cartridges, three choppers, three knives and other weapons in Warje-Malwadi. "The (staffer) found the weapons in a bag in the nullah. It looks like self-loading rifle and pistol cartridges but it is yet to be confirmed," police said. A case has been registered under the Indian Arms Act.

291.title: Infosys to seek shareholders' nod for ₹9,300 crore share buyback
291.article_body: Infosys said that it will seek approval from shareholders for its proposed ₹9,300 crore share buyback between November 3 to December 2 through postal ballot. The buyback is proposed to be implemented by way of open market purchases through Indian stock exchanges. The buyback will be undertaken for a price not exceeding ₹1,850 per equity share.

292.title: Delhi couple killed by 2 fired employees in 'act of revenge'; 2-yr-old kid lone survivor
292.article_body: A couple and their domestic help were murdered at their house in Delhi by two former employees in an "act of revenge", said the police. The wife ran a beauty parlour and had recently fired the two employees, police added. As per officials, the killers missed the couple's two-year-old daughter as she was sleeping under a blanket.

293.title: BMC postpones hike in rent of civic-owned properties till June 2023
293.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has postponed the hike in rent of over 3,500  civic-owned properties till June 2023. These properties house over 45,000 tenants. "We have...decided to postpone the hike...since many tenants are yet to recover from the financial losses they faced during the...lockdown," an official said. Currently, the tenants are charged between ₹100 and ₹250 per month.

294.title: Faridabad restaurant serving hookah at a party raided, 26 arrested
294.article_body: The Chief Minister's flying squad and Faridabad Police raided the basement of a restaurant in Sector 86, where a party was in progress, and arrested 26 people, including eight women, for allegedly serving and consuming hookah. The people were found smoking flavoured tobacco, which is banned, and liquor was being served at the party without a licence, the police said.

295.title: He is gold for us: Phillips on Kane Williamson's 40(40) vs England
295.article_body: Discussing Kane Williamson's 40 off 40 balls in New Zealand's T20 World Cup 2022 match against England, New Zealand batter Glenn Phillips said, "Williamson is gold...for us. He understands situations." "England bowled really well to him and...shut down his areas," added Phillips. "He could...easily get 50 off 20 balls...[in the next game], so we back him fully," he stated.

296.title: Woman missing since 5 yrs reunited with family in J'khand through Aadhaar
296.article_body: A 23-year-old woman who went missing five years ago was reunited with her family in Jharkhand with the help of the Aadhaar database. The woman, Rashmani, was rescued by railway police and housed at a shelter home in UP in 2017 after she deboarded a Delhi-bound train. Rashmani's address was traced when officials tried to apply for her Aadhaar card.

297.title: Akasa Air to start Bengaluru–Pune direct flights on November 23
297.article_body: Akasa Air has added Pune to its service and will launch double daily flights on the Bengaluru-Pune route from November 23. India's newest airline will also start its sixth and seventh frequency flight on the Bengaluru-Mumbai route. With these additions, Akasa Air will offer 20 daily flights from Bengaluru connecting seven cities—Mumbai, Ahmedabad, Delhi, Chennai, Kochi, Guwahati and Pune.

298.title: 10.5 km walk to be precise: Pooja on her 'brief' walk with Rahul Gandhi
298.article_body: Actress Pooja Bhatt joined Congress MP Rahul Gandhi during his ongoing Bharat Jodo Yatra in Hyderabad. Responding to an ANI report which said that Pooja "briefly" joined Rahul on his Bharat Jodo Yatra, Pooja tweeted, "Yes a 'brief' 10.5 km walk to be precise." Pooja recently featured in R Balki's directorial 'Chup: Revenge of the Artist'.

299.title: BJP targeting Punjab farmers as they opposed farm bills: AAP
299.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Wednesday alleged that the BJP was attacking the farmers of Punjab over the issue of reported stubble burning because of their protests against the three contentious farm bills proposed by the Centre. The AAP leader said farmers are forced to burn stubble as the Centre didn't provide cash incentive to stop the practice.

300.title: 6-yr-old Mumbai boy on holiday dies after drowning in pool at Goa hotel
300.article_body: A six-year-old boy from Mumbai died after drowning in the swimming pool at a hotel in Goa. The boy was on holiday with his parents and was staying in a hotel in Candolim when the incident took place. While the police have registered a case of unnatural death into the case, the deceased's family has not suspected any foul play.

301.title: Former Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu leads in exit polls
301.article_body: Former Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu holds an early lead and is close to securing a majority in the 120-seat Knesset, exit polls released on Tuesday night showed. "We're on the brink of a very big victory," Netanyahu said. Netanyahu was ousted last year by a coalition of right and left political parties after being in power for 12 years.

302.title: Rahul doesn’t like backseat driving or asserting his authority: Jairam
302.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi doesn't like backseat driving or asserting his authority, party leader Jairam Ramesh said. "He is a very democratic person," Ramesh added. "I think Rahul Gandhi’s greatest value will be to play the role of an ideological compass for the party," he added. Furthermore, Ramesh said party’s Bharat Jodo Yatra is the "real booster dose" for Congress.

303.title: Karnataka challenging not only other states but also some countries: PM Modi
303.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday said Karnataka is challenging not only other states of India but also some countries. "Karnataka has the power of double engine...one of the reasons why the state...is holding top ranking in ease of doing business and FDI inflow," PM Modi said. The state also has around 400 of the 'Fortune 500' companies, he noted.

304.title: Dharavi has potential to become next BKC: CEO of Dharavi redevelopment
304.article_body: Dharavi has the potential to become the next Bandra Kurla Complex (BKC) after redevelopment, said CEO of Dharavi redevelopment project SVR Srinivas. Over 1 crore square feet of construction is expected to come up in Dharavi in the next 17 years, Srinivas added. "If we want to make Mumbai slum-free...starting point should be a project like Dharavi," he further said.

305.title: Karan Johar recalls his first meeting with SRK on his 57th b'day, says 'Love you Bhai'
305.article_body: On Shah Rukh Khan's 57th birthday, Karan Johar shared a post recalling their first meeting 29 years ago. "The film was 'Karan Arjun'...the set was in Film City...[Shah Rukh] shook my hand and with his immensely kind eyes asked me many questions," he wrote. "Today I call him Bhai...He's more than family...Hail the King!!! Love you Bhai," Karan added.

306.title: I didn't ask for Twitter's blue tick, take it away: Tennis legend Martina to Musk
306.article_body: Czech-American former professional tennis player Martina Navratilova tweeted, "I didn't ask for the blue check mark- it just showed up one day, so feel free to take it away." She added, "Paying for the blue tick is what would bother me." Her tweet came after Elon Musk announced a $8 per month fee for the blue tick on Twitter.

307.title: 20-yr-old kills self after failing to clear Agniveer test in Uttarakhand
307.article_body: A 20-year-old man from Uttarakhand's Bageshwar allegedly killed himself after consuming poison following his failure in clearing the Agniveer recruitment test, the police said. "I have no other option left. I did a lot of hard work. I was rejected from the race despite having an NCC 'C' certificate," he said in a video he made before killing himself.

308.title: B'luru man accuses wife of 'regularly' beating him, complains to PMO
308.article_body: A Bengaluru-based man has accused his wife of beating him regularly and filed a complaint with Prime Minister's Office (PMO), seeking help and protection. "Would anyone help me?...No, because I'm a man! My wife attacked me with knife, is this...naari shakti you boost about?" he tweeted. He tagged PMO, Bengaluru Police Commissioner and Law Minister Kiren Rijiju in the tweet.

309.title: Punjab to have 16 new medical colleges in 5 years: CM Bhagwant Mann
309.article_body: The Punjab government will build 16 new medical colleges in the next five years in the state, Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Tuesday said. This will take the number of government medical colleges in the state to 25, he added. The government has begun a massive recruitment drive to fill all the vacant posts in the health department, Mann stated.

310.title: Nursing staff of Delhi government hospitals on strike from 2 to 4 Nov
310.article_body: The nursing staff of various hospitals run by the Delhi government went on a strike on Wednesday over demands like regularisation of services and long-due promotions. Delhi Nurses Federation (DNF) said the "symbolic strike" would take place from 9-11 am from November 2-4. "Emergency and ICU services won't be affected as nominal staff will work," DNF stated.

311.title: Belgium-based firm SettleMint raises $16 million in Series A round
311.article_body: SettleMint, a Belgium-based blockchain application development program has secured $16 million in a Series A funding round that was co-led by Molten Ventures and OTB Ventures. Other investors like Fujitsu Ventures, Allusion and Bloccelerate and existing investors including Medici Ventures also participated in the funding round. Matthew Van Niekerk and Roderik van der Veer founded the company.

312.title: Shouldn't be taken lightly: Pilot on PM Modi's praise for Gehlot
312.article_body: A day after PM Narendra Modi praised Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot, Congress leader Sachin Pilot said that it is a "very interesting" development that "should not be taken lightly" by the party. "The PM had similarly praised Ghulam Nabi Azad in Parliament. We saw what happened after that," he added. PM Modi visited Mangarh Dham in Rajasthan on Tuesday.

313.title: Hyd school shut over 4-yr-old's rape to remain open for this academic year
313.article_body: The Telangana government allowed a DAV school in Hyderabad to function till the end of the academic year, after revoking the school's licence, following a four-year-old girl's alleged rape by the principal's driver. Parents requested that the school be allowed to function under a different management. An order said that teachers against whom there were complaints would be removed.

314.title: JSW Group plans to invest ₹1 lakh crore in Karnataka: Chairman
314.article_body: JSW Group Chairman Sajjan Jindal said the group is planning to invest ₹1 lakh crore in Karnataka over the next five years. Speaking at the 'Invest Karnataka 2022', he also requested the state government to consider mineral auctions. He said the investment would be directed towards the expansion of its steel plant, and renewable energy and port infrastructure development space.

315.title: Was in ICU: Rajinikanth on not attending Puneeth Rajkumar's funeral
315.article_body: Actor Rajinikanth said that he couldn't attend Kannada actor Puneeth Rajkumar's funeral due to his health condition around the same time. "I had undergone an operation and was in the intensive care unit (ICU)," Rajinikanth shared. Rajinikanth and Jr NTR were present at the 67th Kannada Rajyotsava where Puneeth was posthumously conferred with Karnataka's highest civilian award, Karnataka Ratna.

316.title: Hyd police collect fingerprints from commuters, say it prevents crimes
316.article_body: In Hyderabad, policemen are stopping commuters and coercing them into submitting their fingerprints on a device. Balanagar, Assistant Commissioner of Police A Gangaram, said that this exercise was being conducted to identify offenders and prevent crimes. He added that biometrics of citizens were not being collected, instead the portable device was matching fingerprints with the existing database.

317.title: India record their highest-ever T20I total against Bangladesh
317.article_body: India on Wednesday recorded their highest-ever T20I total against Bangladesh after registering 184/6 in 20 overs in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match in Adelaide. India's previous highest T20I total against Bangladesh had come on June 6, 2009, when they recorded 180/5 in Nottingham. Virat Kohli top-scored for India today with 64*(44).

318.title: Court convicts 41 persons in 2005 Balrampur riots case, 1 convict flees
318.article_body: A court has sentenced 41 persons to five years of imprisonment in connection with the 2005 Balrampur riots in Uttar Pradesh in which at least a dozen people were injured. Notably, one of the convicts managed to escape on the day of the judgement. The accused, who were out on bail, were taken into custody following the verdict.

319.title: Arab League leaders meet in Algeria after 3 years, focus on 'Palestinian cause'
319.article_body: Leaders of Arab countries met at the 31st Arab League summit in Algerian capital, Algiers on Monday, for the first time in three years. Algerian President Abdelmadjid Tebboune said "exceptional global conditions are creating polarisation...which is impacting our food security," without mentioning Russian invasion of Ukraine. "Our central and primary cause remains the Palestinian cause," he added.

320.title: Maha man fraudulently claims GST refund of over ₹27 crore, arrested
320.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested in Maharashtra on Tuesday for fraudulently claiming a GST refund of more than ₹27 crore. A GST official said the man had facilitated the opening of at least two "non-genuine" companies, which availed fake input tax credit worth over ₹34 crore and claimed the refund. These companies had issued bogus bills of over ₹238 crore.

321.title: We prevented a complete downturn of the economy: RBI Governor Das
321.article_body: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das said the central bank has "prevented a complete downturn of the economy". Das added that the debate over RBI being behind the curve in tightening monetary policy was over. "We wanted the economy to safely reach the shores, and thereafter try and pull down inflation," he further said.

322.title: SC rejects plea against Justice Chandrachud becoming CJI, calls it 'misconceived'
322.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday dismissed a plea against the appointment of Justice DY Chandrachud as the next CJI, saying the petition was "misconceived". During the hearing in the matter, the petitioner's counsel cited some "irregularities and illegal acts" allegedly committed by Justice Chandrachud. The bench, led by CJI UU Lalit, said, "We see no reason to entertain this petition."

323.title: Seychelles-based crypto firm Huobi Global rejects mass layoff rumours: Report
323.article_body: Seychelles-based crypto exchange Huobi Global has called "large-scale layoff" reports "untrue" and rejected allegations that two of its top executives resigned, Cointelegraph reported. This comes after Chinese journalist Colin Wu claimed that the company's CEO and CFO resigned, and that it is preparing for "large-scale" layoffs. "Some cost-cutting could be on the cards," a spokesperson added.

324.title: In a first, men's washroom in Mumbai Metro to have diaper-changing facility
324.article_body: Mumbai Metro is all set to become the first metro rail service in India to have men's washrooms with diaper-changing facilities. All 26 stations in Metro 3 from Cuffe Parade to SEEPZ will have this facility. "Our intent is...to not [cause] inconvenience [to] children and their parents while changing their diapers," a spokesperson from Mumbai Metro Rail Corporation said.

325.title: World considers India as bright spot: PM at Invest Karnataka Summit
325.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said despite world going through a phase of "global crisis", world considers India as a "bright spot" as we continue our initiatives to strengthen fundamentals of our economy. "Free trade deals that have been signed give world a glimpse of our preparedness," PM Modi said during his virtual inaugural address at Invest Karnataka 2022 Summit.

326.title: Teaser of 'Pathaan' released on Shah Rukh Khan's 57th birthday
326.article_body: The teaser of Siddharth Anand-directorial 'Pathaan' was released on the occasion of Shah Rukh Khan's 57th birthday on Wednesday. "Fasten your seatbelts...Pathaan teaser out now," Shah Rukh wrote while sharing the teaser on Instagram. The film also stars Deepika Padukone and John Abraham. It is scheduled to release on January 25, 2023.

327.title: Will of God: Accused on Gujarat's Morbi bridge collapse that killed 135 people
327.article_body: Deepak Parekh, one of the Oreva Group managers arrested in Gujarat's Morbi bridge collapse case, told the court that it was "the will of God" that the incident took place. Oreva was responsible for the maintenance of the bridge which collapsed, resulting in the loss of 135 lives. Parekh is one of the nine people arrested in the case.

328.title: 2,000 people buy QR code tickets for B'luru metro on 1st day of rollout
328.article_body: Nearly 2,000 people reportedly bought QR code tickets via WhatsApp and the Namma Metro application to use Bengaluru metro on Tuesday, which was the first day of the scheme's rollout. The system enables commuters to ride the metro without using tokens or smart cards. Commuters can now select their origin and drop destinations on the app and purchase single-trip tickets.

329.title: All smartphones except iPhones to get 5G from mid-November: Airtel CEO
329.article_body: Bharti Airtel's CEO Gopal Vittal has said that all 5G-enabled smartphones, except Apple's iPhones, will start supporting Airtel 5G services by the middle of November. He said that Apple will release the software update needed to support 5G in the first week of November. All of the Apple devices should support the 5G services by mid-December, the Airtel CEO added.

330.title: India has UPI AutoPay to collect 'blue tick' fees: NPCI CEO to Twitter
330.article_body: Amid a debate over Elon Musk's decision to charge Twitter users $8/month for 'blue ticks', National Payments Corporation of India's (NPCI) MD and CEO Dilip Asbe has pitched the UPI AutoPay to take care of the monthly payments. Responding to Musk's tweet, Asbe wrote, "No worries, India has UPI AutoPay...to collect every anytime/month/quarter or yearly as you wish dear Twitter".

331.title: MP teacher holds liquor, non-veg food party in school, suspended
331.article_body: A government school teacher was suspended for alleged violation of service conduct rules after he held a party where liquor and non-vegetarian food were served on school premises in MP’s Shivpuri, an official said. A video of the party went viral on social media. There had been complaints about him holding such parties regularly on school premises, official stated.

332.title: 3 new model corridors to come up in Hyderabad: Report
332.article_body: The western part of Hyderabad will get three new model corridors as the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) is likely to approve the proposal this week, reports said. The corridors will come up at Hyderabad’s Nanakramguda Junction to IT Heights Road, Biodiversity to Leather Institute and IT Heights Road to Khajaguda Junction and it will be developed with ₹16.7 crore.

333.title: Cong leader injured after being 'pushed' by police during Bharat Jodo Yatra, pic surfaces
333.article_body: Congress leader Nitin Raut sustained injuries after he was allegedly pushed by police personnel during Bharat Jodo Yatra in Telangana. Raut has been admitted to Hyderabad's Vasavi Hospital. He sustained injuries in his right eye, hands and legs. "I was moving towards stage when Rahul Gandhi's convoy came, police panicked and pushed me. I fell near a barricade," he stated.

334.title: Tesla shuts down its first store in China amid retail strategy shift: Report
334.article_body: Tesla has reportedly shut down its first showroom in China as the electric vehicle giant is adjusting its sales and service strategy in its second-largest market. Tesla's showroom in Beijing's Parkview Green was shut down and now the showroom's windows are plastered with posters belonging to the next tenant. Notably, the store opened in 2013 and was renovated in 2018.

335.title: Farah says SRK made her filmmaker, posts pic from his b'day celebration
335.article_body: Farah Khan on Wednesday shared a picture from Shah Rukh Khan's birthday celebration, which took place at his house, Mannat. The celebration was also joined by Shah Rukh's manager Pooja Dadlani. Earlier, Farah shared a video on Instagram and called him the man who made her a filmmaker. "The world is lucky to have you," she wrote on Instagram Stories.

336.title: Elon Musk asks over 50 employees from his other firms to work at Twitter: Reports
336.article_body: Elon Musk has authorised over 50 employees from his other companies to work at Twitter, according to reports. These include 50 employees from Tesla, two from The Boring Company and one from Neuralink, reports said. The employees reportedly include Tesla's Director - Autopilot Software Ashok Elluswamy and Director of Engineering - Autopilot & Tesla Bot Milan Kovac.

337.title: Virat Kohli breaks record for smashing most runs in T20 World Cup history
337.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli on Wednesday broke the record for smashing most runs in T20 World Cup history. During his innings against Bangladesh in their T20 World Cup 2022 match, Kohli overtook former Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena's record tally of 1,016 runs in T20 World Cups. Kohli crossed Jayawardena's mark in just 23 innings.

338.title: Pressure to deliver was immense: Siddharth Anand on 'Pathaan' teaser
338.article_body: Director Siddharth Anand shared that because the team had decided to release the teaser of 'Pathaan' on Shah Rukh Khan's birthday, "the pressure to deliver was immense". "It had to be spectacular and memorable at the same time," Anand said, adding that the team is aiming to make 'Pathaan' "the biggest action spectacle". The film also stars Deepika Padukone.

339.title: India's Suryakumar Yadav becomes world number one T20I batter
339.article_body: Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav has become the world number one T20I batter, as per the latest ICC rankings. The 32-year-old has now accumulated 863 rating points. He overtook Pakistan wicketkeeper-opener Muhammad Rizwan, who is now ranked second with 842 rating points. Virat Kohli (tenth) is the only other Indian in the top 10.

340.title: Mumbai woman cheated of ₹2.75 lakh by man claiming to be pilot from France
340.article_body: A 36-year-old Mumbai woman was cheated of ₹2.75 lakh by a man claiming to be a pilot from France on matrimonial app. The fraudster told the victim that he was coming to India to meet her but got detained at Delhi airport and needed ₹2.75 lakh to get bail. The victim got suspicious after being asked for ₹6.5 lakh more.

341.title: Woman gets stuck in elevator that collapsed in Mumbai, dies
341.article_body: A 62-year-old woman died after getting stuck in an elevator that collapsed in a residential building in Mumbai's Charkop, police said on Wednesday. The incident occurred in the multi-storey building when the woman was going down from the fourth floor for a morning walk. When a security guard tried to help, the elevator collapsed on the ground floor, police added.

342.title: I’d rather look at you than anything else: Dia as she shares pic from 2000 on SRK's b'day
342.article_body: Actress Dia Mirza took to Twitter to share a photo from 2000, featuring Shah Rukh Khan, Lara Dutta and Priyanka Chopra. While wishing Shah Rukh Khan on his birthday, Dia wrote, "I’d rather look at you than anything else- then, now and forever! Thank you for bringing so much joy to our lives. Thank you for being you."

343.title: Indonesian man known as 'Playboy King' to marry ex-wife in his 88th wedding
343.article_body: A 61-year-old Indonesian man is set to marry for the 88th time. The man known as "Playboy King" will be marrying his ex-wife. "Although it has been a long time since we separated, the love between us is still strong," he said, adding that he married for the first time when he was 14 years old.

344.title: Karnataka Bank's stock hits 52-week high after quarterly results
344.article_body: A day after Karnataka Bank posted an all-time high net profit of ₹411 crore for the September quarter, its stock opened 17% higher on Wednesday to hit a 52-week high. Its net profit surged by 228% year-on-year and its net interest income increased by 26%. At 12:30 pm, its stock was trading 19.99% higher at ₹112.55/share on BSE.

345.title: Delhi to give ₹5,000 per month to workers during ban on construction activities
345.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said that he has directed Labour Minister Manish Sisodia to give ₹5,000 per month as financial support to workers till the time construction activities are banned. Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Sunday announced that the Delhi government has decided to implement the Commission for Air Quality Management's order, imposing a ban on construction and demolition activities.

346.title: India announce their playing XI for T20 World Cup 2022 match against Bangladesh
346.article_body: Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match in Adelaide. India have made one change to their playing XI, with Axar Patel replacing Deepak Hooda. India are currently placed second on Group 2 points table, while Bangladesh are third.

347.title: Arshdeep's the 1st Indian bowler after Zaheer with unpredictable pace: Ajmal
