347.article_body: Talking about Arshdeep Singh, ex-Pakistan spinner Saeed Ajmal said, "He gets two balls to move away and then gets one to jag back in. That...ball...is very difficult to face. Wasim Akram...[would] do the...same thing." "After Zaheer Khan, Arshdeep's the first Indian bowler whose swing and pace are unpredictable," added Ajmal. "You can't figure out what Arshdeep...[will] bowl," he stated.

348.title: Played Feroz Khan's elder sister when he was 20 yrs older than me: Neena
348.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta said that she had once played late actor Feroz Khan's elder sister in a film. "He was 20 years older than me," she recalled, adding that she had played many such parts as these were the only roles she'd get in films. Neena will be seen in Sooraj Barjatya's upcoming film 'Uunchai', which also stars Amitabh Bachchan.

349.title: German firm Volocopter raises $182 mn in 2nd signing of Series E round
349.article_body: Volocopter, a German startup that builds electric vertical takeoff and landing vehicles, has secured $182 million for the second signing of its Series E round. The total size of Volocopter's latest round reached over $350 million, the largest deeptech round in Germany this year. The funds came from Saudi Arabia's smart city project NEOM and Hong Kong mobility fund GLy.

350.title: Cylinder blast at Mumbai's Dadar school; 3 injured, 2 cars damaged
350.article_body: At least three people were injured after a fire broke out on the terrace of Chhabildas English Medium School in Dadar, Mumbai due to an LPG gas cylinder explosion. The roof of the school building reportedly collapsed due to the explosion. Two cars also got damaged in the incident, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said.

351.title: Netherlands record their 1st win in T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage, defeat Zimbabwe
351.article_body: Netherlands defeated Zimbabwe by five wickets in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage Group 2 match on Wednesday. It is Netherlands' first victory in the Super 12 stage of the ongoing tournament. Further, it is Netherlands' second victory in the second round in the history of T20 World Cup. Paul van Meekeren took three wickets for Netherlands today.

352.title: Cong's Bharat Jodo Yatra is bringing about silent revolution: Kharge
352.article_body: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge on Wednesday said that the party’s Bharat Jodo Yatra is bringing about a silent revolution that will change the political landscape. "Interacted with the Bharat yatris at Bowenpally in Hyderabad. They too are walking 3,500 kms with ⁦Rahul Gandhi⁩ Ji and are a source of great inspiration to our party cadres," Kharge tweeted.

353.title: Miss Grand Argentina and Miss Grand Puerto Rico 2020 get married; post video
353.article_body: Miss Grand International Argentina 2020 Mariana Varela and Miss Grand International Puerto Rico 2020 Fabiola Valentín announced their marriage on social media by sharing a video. "After deciding to keep our relationship private, we opened the doors to it on a special day, 28/10/22," the caption read. "Congratulations to both of you," Miss Grand International's Instagram profile said.

354.title: Suhana shares throwback pic with Shah Rukh on his b'day, calls him her 'bestest friend'
354.article_body: On the occasion of Shah Rukh Khan's 57th birthday, his daughter Suhana shared an old photo featuring the two of them and Aryan on her Instagram. Sharing the photo, she wrote, "Happy birthday to my bestest friend. I love you the most." In a rare gesture, Shah Rukh greeted fans waiting outside his residence at midnight on his birthday.

355.title: Messi confuses players by seeming less interested, then changing pace: Henry
355.article_body: Former Barcelona footballer Thierry Henry said most defenders get "confused" by the manner in which Lionel Messi always seems "less interested" when the game starts, going on to change his pace later. "Messi is in frightening form [this season]," added Henry. Messi has scored 12 goals and registered 13 assists having played 17 matches so far for PSG this season.

356.title: Fresh produce startup Otipy appoints Rohit Sood as Chief Business Officer
356.article_body: Otipy, a fresh produce startup, appointed Rohit Sood as its Chief Business Officer. Sood has over 16 years of experience and has been associated with companies such as SPAR, Carrefour, Snapdeal, Paytm Mall and JioMart. Earlier this year, Otipy, backed by WestBridge Capital, Omidyar Network, SIG and others, had raised $32 million in a series B funding round.

357.title: US-based AI lending firm Upstart lays off 140 employees: Report
357.article_body: US-based AI lending platform Upstart has laid off 140 employees, TechCrunch reported. "We are making this difficult decision for the long-term health of the company," an Upstart spokesperson said, adding that no further layoffs are expected. In the latest filing, the company said that the decision was taken due to "reduction in the volume of loans" on its platform.

358.title: 2 lawyers' bodies refuse to represent 9 accused in Morbi bridge collapse case
358.article_body: Two lawyers' bodies in Gujarat have decided not to represent the nine accused arrested over the Morbi bridge collapse that killed at least 135 people. The resolution was passed by the Morbi Bar Association and Rajkot Bar Association on Wednesday. Among those arrested are managers of Oreva, the company that renovated the bridge, bridge repair contractors and three security guards.

359.title: Driver attached to Kerala minister's office arrested in molestation case
359.article_body: Kerala Police arrested a driver attached to the office of an LDF minister in connection with the cases of molesting a woman doctor in Thiruvananthapuram and of trespassing into a house. The accused is the driver of the personal secretary of Irrigation Minister Roshy Augustine. The department has been directed to immediately remove the driver from office, Augustine said.

360.title: Özil will never play for another English club, he's not Aubameyang: Agent
360.article_body: Former Arsenal footballer Mesut Özil's agent Dr Erkut Sogut said Özil will never play for another English club as he is not like ex-Arsenal footballer Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang, who currently represents Chelsea. "Özil loved his time at Arsenal," added Sogut. "If there was a discussion to go to another Premier League club...it would have never, ever happened," Sogut had earlier stated.

361.title: SaaS firm Freshworks' Q3 revenue rises by 37% y-o-y to $128.8 mn
361.article_body: Software-as-a-service (SaaS) firm Freshworks posted a 37% rise in consolidated revenue at $128.8 million year-on-year for the third quarter ended September. This was led by improved operating efficiency and customer additions. The firm's operational loss was recorded at $58.3 million during the quarter as against $67.4 million in the previous quarter. Its quarter-on-quarter revenue was around 5%.

362.title: Temasek will not exit company as of now: Medanta-owner Global Health
362.article_body: The management of Global Health Limited, which operates and manages Medanta hospitals, said Temasek will not exit the company as of now. Temasek currently holds a 19% stake in Global Health. Global Health's IPO will open for subscription on Thursday and the price band has been fixed at ₹319-₹336 per share. Carlyle is another shareholder, which holds around 20% stake.

363.title: What is India's record against Bangladesh in T20I cricket?
363.article_body: India and Bangladesh have played 11 T20Is against each other, with India winning 10 times and losing once. India have won four of their last five T20I matches against Bangladesh. India's highest T20I total against Bangladesh is 180/5, which they registered in June 2009. Rohit Sharma has scored 452 runs in T20Is against Bangladesh, most by a Team India batter.

364.title: Some Twitter staff told to work 12-hr shifts, 7 days in office after Musk takeover: Reports
364.article_body: Managers at Twitter have reportedly instructed some employees to work 12-hour shifts, seven days a week, to meet deadlines after Elon Musk’s takeover. As per another report, some managers even slept at the office on the weekend. Twitter employees who were there before Musk’s acquisition, have reportedly been asked to justify their work and their teams' work.

365.title: Invested in Twitter in support of freedom of speech: Binance CEO
365.article_body: Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao has said he is "extremely supportive" of freedom of speech, which is the main reason behind his company's $500 million investment into Elon Musk's Twitter buyout. Zhao called Twitter "an important free speech platform". Last week, Binance said it is creating a team to work on how blockchain and crypto could be helpful to Twitter.

366.title: Officer saves child who fell from mother's arms at Mumbai station
366.article_body: A Railways officer saved a child from slipping under the train tracks at Mumbai's Mankhurd Railway Station. The child fell from the mother's arm while she was trying to board a local train and lost her balance. In the video, shared by Railway Protection Force (RPF), the officer is seen dragging the child away from the edge of the station.

367.title: India reports 1,190 COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 16,243
367.article_body: India reported 1,190 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 1,046 fresh COVID-19 cases. The active cases went down to 16,243 from the earlier 17,618. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,30,452, according to the ministry.

368.title: Man accused of attacking Pelosi's husband was on 'suicide mission': Report
368.article_body: David DePape, accused of breaking into US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's house and beating her husband, has told police that he was on a "suicide mission", court filing showed. DePape had plans to target other California and federal politicians. The filing mentioned that Paul Pelosi was knocked unconscious by a hammer and he woke up in a pool of blood.

369.title: My kids and I are safe now: Rambha after her car accident in Canada
369.article_body: Actress Rambha, who recently met with an accident in Canada, informed her fans that she and her kids are safe. "My daughter Sasha is also safe. We all came back to our house," she shared. The actress thanked her fans, friends, and family members for their prayers and expressed how she felt "overwhelmed" by their support.

370.title: I will not fight anymore to be no. 1 like I did in the past: Nadal
370.article_body: Rafael Nadal said he will "not fight" anymore to become the world number one like he did in the past. "I achieved that goal a couple of times...[in] my career...[and] I have been very, very happy and proud about achieving that," added Nadal. "I just fight to keep being competitive in every event that I play," stated Nadal.

371.title: SRK would spread a cloth & sleep on floor if vanity van wasn't ready, recalls Aditya
371.article_body: On the occasion of Shah Rukh Khan's birthday, Aditya Narayan recalled shooting with him for 'Pardes'. He said, "I remember he was shooting for another film, he used to come to sets, vanity van wouldn’t be ready. He would...pick a corner in the room, put his bag, spread a cloth on the floor, and sleep….No complaints and no ego."

372.title: Singer Davido's 3-year-old son dies after drowning in swimming pool at home in Nigeria
372.article_body: Afrobeats star Davido's son Ifeanyi Adeleke, who turned three last month, passed away after drowning in the swimming pool at his home in Nigeria's Lagos. The Nigerian police have summoned eight domestic workers for questioning. "We are reviewing the CCTV cameras to get additional information about the circumstances of his death," an official said.

373.title: I feel sick, I threw up: Dokic on video of man assaulting daughter during tennis practice
373.article_body: Ex-women's world number four tennis player Jelena Dokic has reacted to a viral video of a man in Serbia slapping and kicking his 14-year-old daughter during tennis practice. "I feel sick...I threw up and I'm heartbroken," the Australian wrote. "Just another day for us and that includes this...girl. Imagine what happens behind closed doors. It's even worse," she added.

374.title: Liverpool, Spurs enter CL round of 16; Bayern maintain unbeaten run
374.article_body: Liverpool and Tottenham Hotspur entered the round of 16 stage of the ongoing edition of the Champions League, following a 2-0 win against Napoli and 2-1 triumph against Marseille respectively. Liverpool had earlier suffered a 1-4 defeat against Napoli. Bayern Munich maintained their unbeaten run in the ongoing season, recording a 2-0 win against Inter Milan.

375.title: China locks down area around world's largest iPhone factory over COVID outbreak
375.article_body: China has locked down area around the world's largest iPhone factory in Zhengzhou over a COVID-19 outbreak. The lockdown will last until November 9, the local government said in a statement posted on its WeChat account. No vehicles are allowed to operate except for those carrying necessities, the government further said.

376.title: Actress Pooja Bhatt joins Rahul for Cong’s Bharat Jodo Yatra in Hyd
376.article_body: Actress Pooja Bhatt on Wednesday briefly joined Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra in Hyderabad and walked with party leader Rahul Gandhi. "Every day a new history is being created...Every day the number of people who love is increasing in the country," the party wrote while tweeting photos of Bhatt joining the yatra. The yatra resumed from Hyderabad today morning.

377.title: Hansika Motwani to marry businessman Sohael Khaturiya, shares proposal pics
377.article_body: Actress Hansika Motwani took to Instagram on Wednesday to share photos with Mumbai-based entrepreneur Sohael Khaturiya from their proposal in Paris. Sharing the photos, she wrote, "Now & Forever." As per reports, she will marry her friend and business partner Sohael in the first week of December. The wedding will reportedly take place at Mundota Fort and Palace in Jaipur.

378.title: Heroin worth ₹5 crore, hidden inside 52 soap cases, seized in Assam
378.article_body: Assam's Karimganj Police on Monday seized 676 grams of heroin worth around ₹5 crore. "Police intercepted a vehicle coming from a neighbouring state...seized heroin packed in 52 soap cases, which were carefully packed inside baby wet wipes and stacked inside the sound box of the vehicle," CM Himanta Biswa Sarma tweeted. Sarma also shared a video of the incident.

379.title: Govt should tell who is responsible for deaths: Owaisi on Morbi bridge collapse
379.article_body: Reacting to the Morbi bridge collapse incident, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that this is a "painful accident" and we hope that PM Narendra Modi and the Gujarat government will give justice to the families of those who lost their lives. "Government should tell who is responsible for the deaths of so many people," he added.

380.title: S Korean PM urges police to explain response to emergency calls before stampede
380.article_body: South Korean Prime Minister Han Duck-soo has said that police must explain how they responded to multiple emergency calls before more than 150 people were killed in a stampede in Seoul. "The police must conduct thorough inspections and provide a clear and transparent explanation," Han said. Emergency calls' transcripts showed first warning came four hours before the stampede.

381.title: South Korea fires 3 missiles after North Korea launches over 10 missiles
381.article_body: South Korea's military said on Wednesday it had fired three precision air-to-ground missiles near the spot on the maritime border where a North Korean missile landed earlier in the day. North Korea had fired more than 10 missiles. South Korean military called the firing of missiles by North Korea "very rare and intolerable".

382.title: LIC Housing Finance stock falls by 10% after September quarter results
382.article_body: Shares of LIC Housing Finance hit the 10% lower circuit on Wednesday after posting a 23% year-on-year growth in net profit at ₹305 crore in the September quarter. Its net interest income for the quarter fell by 80 basis points to ₹1,163 crore from ₹1,173 crore. At 10: 25 am, its stock was trading 9.58% lower at ₹362.05/piece on BSE.

383.title: Mutual love & affection between minor couple not sexual assault under POCSO: HC
383.article_body: The Meghalaya High Court held that acts of mutual love and affection between a young couple will not amount to "sexual assault" under the POCSO act. The court made this observation while quashing POCSO charges against a minor’s partner. The accused was booked after the minor girl’s mother alleged that he had sexually assaulted her daughter.

384.title: Shah Rukh said audience clapped on my entry in 'DDLJ': Himani Shivpuri
384.article_body: Himani Shivpuri recalled that Shah Rukh Khan had asked her to watch 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge' in theatres to experience audiences' response to her entry scene. "'Crowds clap when you make your entry,' he told me," Shivpuri said. She stated that during the iconic saree scene, even though Shah Rukh had a different shot, he stood and gave his reactions.

385.title: Don't think it'll happen: Hathaway on 'The Devil Wears Prada' sequel
385.article_body: Actress Anne Hathaway said that she doesn't know if there can be a sequel to 'The Devil Wears Prada'. Even though the idea of a sequel "is tempting" for Anne, she stated that the film was made "in a different era" and now, everything is "very different". "They could relaunch it, get some new people and do it," she added.

386.title: PM gives orders to Telangana CM KCR on phone, says Rahul Gandhi
386.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, while addressing a gathering in Telangana, on Tuesday said Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao gets orders from PM Narendra Modi on phone. "Whenever there's any bill in Parliament, TRS supports BJP and diverts attention from Opposition's issues," Gandhi added. "Your CM does drama before polls but he's in direct line with PM Modi," he stated.

387.title: Punjab starts entrepreneur scheme in 31 govt schools as pilot project
387.article_body: Punjab Minister of School Education Harjot Singh Bains on Tuesday launched the "Business Blasters Young Entrepreneur Scheme" as a pilot project in 31 government schools across Punjab. "We aim to launch it in all senior secondary schools next year," he tweeted. Under the scheme, the students of Class 11 will be provided seed money of ₹2,000 to start a business.

388.title: Laptop lifting gang busted, 41 cases solved: Pune Police
388.article_body: The Pune City Police busted a laptop lifting gang operating in the city and solved 41 cases and recovered 16 laptops and a motorcycle worth ₹8.35 lakh from the accused. The accused used to target parked cars and by breaking windows they used to steal laptops, the police said. The stolen laptops were sold in Delhi and Haryana markets.

389.title: Fusion Microfinance ₹1,104-cr IPO opens today, issue to end on Friday
389.article_body: The initial public offering (IPO) of Fusion Microfinance is set to open for public subscription on Wednesday and will end on Friday. The company has fixed a price band of ₹350-₹368/share for its ₹1,104-crore IPO. The IPO comprises a fresh issue of ₹600 crore worth of equity shares and an offer for sale (OFS) of 1.36 crore equity shares.

390.title: UPL Founder Rajju Shroff steps down as CMD, Jai Shroff named Chairman
390.article_body: Global crop protection products manufacturer UPL announced that its Founder Rajju Shroff has stepped down as Chairman and Managing Director (CMD). Shroff, 90, will become Chairman Emeritus of the Board, effective from December 1, 2022, the company said in its filing. Jai Shroff, a Non-executive Director has been designated as the Chairman of the Board with effect from December 1.

391.title: Kohli gave importance to fielding, Rohit's not bothered: Ajay Jadeja
391.article_body: Discussing India's fielding in a T20 World Cup 2022 match against South Africa, Ajay Jadeja said, "Team India...isn't much athletic...Rohit Sharma isn't bothered about fielding." "[The] last time I heard about...importance [being given] to fielding was when Virat Kohli became the captain," added Ajay. Ajay stated that one cannot expect "good" fielding from Ravichandran Ashwin and Mohammad Shami.

392.title: Can resign within week if CM permits & face bypoll: Maha minister to Aaditya
392.article_body: Maharashtra minister Abdul Sattar challenged state minister Aaditya Thackeray to face an election by resigning from his constituency. Sattar said he's ready to tender his resignation within a week if CM Eknath Shinde allows him and face a byelection from Sillod constituency. "Even if he (Aaditya) doesn’t tender his resignation…I can resign within one week and face election," Sattar stated.

393.title: Have never participated in or produced anything pornographic in my life: Raj Kundra
393.article_body: During an #AskRaj session, Raj Kundra responded to a Twitter user about his arrest in connection with the alleged creation and uploading of porn films on apps. He wrote, "I can assure my well-wishers (that) I have never participated in or produced anything pornographic in my life." Kundra was arrested in July 2021 and was granted bail two months later.

394.title: Which are the highest match aggregates in T20 history as world record gets broken?
394.article_body: The Titans-Knights CSA T20 Challenge match witnessed combined 501 runs, breaking the world record for the highest match aggregate in T20 cricket history. The previous highest aggregate (497 runs) was recorded in Central Districts-Otago match in 2016. A Trinbago Knight Riders-Jamaica Tallawahs match in 2019 witnessed 493 runs, the third-highest match aggregate.

395.title: Indian-origin former employee admits cheating Apple of ₹140 crore
395.article_body: Dhirendra Prasad, a former Apple employee, has pleaded guilty to fraud that led to a loss of more than $17 million (₹140 crore) to the company, according to a statement from the California Department of Justice. Indian-origin Prasad said he began to defraud Apple back in 2011 by inflating invoices, stealing parts and charging Apple for services it never received.

396.title: Delhi's air quality 'very poor' with 354 AQI; Noida's 'severe' with 406
396.article_body: Delhi's overall air quality on Wednesday morning was recorded as 'very poor' with an air quality index (AQI) of 354. The AQI in Uttar Pradesh's Noida stood at 406 in the 'severe' category, while in Gurugram it stood at 346 in the 'very poor' category. An AQI of 350 was recorded near the Terminal 3 of the Delhi airport.

397.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro authorises transition of power after losing in Prez polls
397.article_body: In his first public remarks after losing election, Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro did not concede defeat, but authorised his team to begin transition process. Bolsonaro's comment came 44 hours after electoral authorities announced the election result. Meanwhile, his supporters blocked highways and some called for a military coup to stop President-elect Lula da Silva from returning to power.

398.title: ED summons Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Thursday in illegal mining case
398.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Thursday in a money laundering probe linked to an alleged illegal mining case in the state. ED filed a charge-sheet in September 2022 under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) in connection with illegal mining and extortion in Jharkhand and Bihar. Earlier, ED arrested Soren's aide Pankaj Mishra.

399.title: You need to be very careful with words: Afridi on Gambhir criticising Babar
399.article_body: Reacting to Gautam Gambhir criticising Babar Azam, Shahid Afridi said, "We'll try to ask Babar to say something about Gambhir after the T20 World Cup 2022." "You need to be very careful with words," added Afridi. Discussing Babar Azam's captaincy during a T20 World Cup 2022 match, Gambhir had stated that Babar should think about his team instead of himself.

400.title: BMC cancels ₹5,800 crore tender issued to make Mumbai free of potholes
400.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) announced that it was scrapping the ₹5,800-crore tender that it had floated on August 2 for completing cement concretisation of 400 km of Mumbai's roads to make the city free of potholes. The tenders were cancelled due to low response from the bidders who blamed the stringent eligibility criteria laid by the civic body.

401.title: Shah Rukh Khan greets fans outside Mannat on his 57th birthday
401.article_body: Bollywood actor Shah Rukh Khan came to the balcony of Mannat, his Mumbai house, to greet fans who had gathered to celebrate his 57th birthday. The actor was joined by his youngest child, AbRam. In a video, Shah Rukh was seen doing his signature pose. He also took a selfie from his balcony and greeted his fans with folded hands.
